title: Mechanical Design Engineer – CREO | In-house Team for Heavy Vehicles
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



We're looking for an experienced Mechanical Design Engineer with CREO expertise to join our in-house development team focusing on heavy vehicles – are you our next colleague?



As a design engineer with us, you’ll be an important part of a dedicated team working on the development of tomorrow’s trucks. You’ll be responsible for designing within your area of expertise, in a cross-functional environment, collaborating closely with colleagues and suppliers. The role also includes participating in concept studies, continuous improvements, and supplier communication.



You will be based at our welcoming office in the heart of Lindholmen Science Park – an inspiring location close to innovation, the waterfront, and public transport.



**WHO ARE YOU?**



* Minimum 3 years of experience working with **CREO Parametric**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Product Development, or similar
* Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English

**Preferred qualifications:**



* Experience in the heavy vehicle industry (e.g. Volvo, Scania)
* Experience working with **KOLA**
* Genuine interest in technology and product development
* Familiarity with requirements engineering, agile methodology, JIRA, or project management

You are communicative, collaborative, and easily adapt to new conditions and customer needs. You thrive in dynamic environments, are driven, and are motivated by personal and professional growth.



We value individuals who are solution-oriented, engaged, and bring a positive attitude that contributes to a great team spirit. You enjoy working cross-functionally and have experience doing so.



**WHAT DO WE OFFER?**



As a consultant with us, you get the best of both worlds – the opportunity to work across a variety of industries and projects, with the security of a stable employer. We deliver cutting-edge expertise in areas such as Product Development, UX & Design, PLM, Industrial IT, Production Technology, and Project Management.



Assignments take place either at our clients’ sites or as in-house projects from our vibrant office in Lindholmen Science Park.



We like doing things together and strive for a healthy balance between work and life – whether it’s after-work events, sports activities, inspiration talks, skiing trips, or conferences. We’ve had some amazing experiences together – our latest trip took us all the way to South Africa to celebrate our 10th anniversary as a consultancy firm!



Continuous development is important to us. In addition to technical training and new challenges in your projects, we offer internal programs focused on personal growth and leadership.



We also believe that autonomy, involvement, and influence are key to staying motivated and achieving your goals. Many of our employees have chosen us because we share that perspective – not just on careers, but on life in general. For us, **who you are** is just as important as **what you do**. Our aim is to help you grow and evolve into something great – together with our clients.



**SIGMA GROUP**



As part of Sigma Group, we offer the best of both worlds – the stability of a large organization and the entrepreneurial spirit of a smaller company.



We are one of several companies under the Sigma umbrella, each focusing on different technical areas. With over 5,000 employees in 14 countries, Sigma is Sweden’s largest privately owned consulting group.



*We will be on summer break starting from week 28, and the recruitment process will resume in week 33. You are very welcome to submit your application now – we will get back to you as soon as we’re back from the holidays.*

title: Powertrain Engineer – Automotive
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Do you want to help shape the future of powertrains for heavy vehicles and industry?**



At Sigma Industry West, we’re seeing a growing demand for experienced engineers with expertise in powertrain – and we’re now looking for someone who wants to be part of developing the next generation of driveline systems within the automotive industry.



With us, you’ll work in a project-based environment, either on-site with our clients or in our in-house team based at Lindholmen, focusing on the development of powertrains, gearboxes and engines (ICE, PHEV, BEV).



As a Powertrain Engineer, you’ll play a key role in development projects for heavy-duty vehicles. Your tasks may include design, component responsibility, or technical project management. The scope and content of the projects vary, but all are conducted in close collaboration with our customers – often in an international context.



We offer a flexible work environment based at our inspiring office at Lindholmen – with a strong focus on sustainable transport solutions, technical innovation, and your continued professional growth.



**ARE YOU THE ONE?**



* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Product Development or similar
* At least 3 years of experience in design (preferably with CREO) or technical leadership within powertrain or engine development
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset
* A structured, analytical approach and a genuine passion for technology

**It's a plus if you also have:**



* Experience in the heavy vehicle industry
* Proficiency in Creo – highly meritorious
* Familiarity with KOLA, GCR or working with international suppliers

We believe you are a communicative and adaptable person who quickly adjusts to new conditions and customer needs. You thrive in dynamic environments, are driven, and motivated by learning and taking on new challenges.



You are solution-oriented, engaged and bring a positive attitude that contributes to a great team spirit. Cross-functional collaboration is something you both enjoy and excel at.



**WHO ARE WE?**



As a consultant at Sigma Industry West, you get the best of both worlds: the variety and development of consulting – with the security of a stable, long-term employer. We provide cutting-edge expertise in areas like Product Development, UX & Design, PLM, Industrial IT, Production Technology, and Project Management. Your assignment may be at the client site or from our vibrant in-house office located in the heart of Lindholmen Science Park.



We believe in doing things together and value a healthy mix of work and fun – from afterworks, events, and workouts to ski trips and inspirational talks. We've taken many exciting trips together and just recently returned from South Africa(!) where we celebrated our 10th anniversary as a consultancy firm.



Competence development has always been a priority for us. In addition to learning in your assignments and various technical trainings, we offer internal programs for personal growth.



We also believe that autonomy, involvement, and influence are key to achieving your personal goals. Our employees have chosen us because we share this view on career, life, and development. To us, who you are is just as important as what you do. Our ambition is to help you grow and evolve into something great – together with our clients.



**Sigma Group**



As part of Sigma Group, we offer the best of both worlds: entrepreneurial spirit and long-term stability.



We’re the smaller company within the larger Sigma network – a group of companies with specialized expertise across different engineering fields. Today, we are over 5,000 employees in 14 countries, making us Sweden’s largest privately owned consulting group.

title: Group Design Leader
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



We are looking for someone with experience in leading technical development projects within the automotive industry – someone who is now ready to take the next step into the role of Group Design Leader. This opportunity involves an exciting and challenging project within interior systems, based at our office in Lindholmen, Gothenburg.



As a Group Design Leader, you will have overall responsibility for the development of selected components or systems. This includes driving the project through all phases – from concept to delivery – with full focus on ensuring that technical solutions are delivered on time, within budget, and at the right level of quality. You will play a key role in coordinating various teams and stakeholders and work closely with suppliers, purchasing, design, manufacturing engineering, and project management. The assignment is carried out in an international environment, which requires strong communication skills and the ability to build trustful and collaborative relationships.



An important part of your role will be to actively participate in sourcing activities and the selection of suppliers. We value a strong business understanding and the ability to take ownership not only of your individual responsibilities but also of the project’s shared goals.



**WHO ARE YOU?**



We believe you are a solution-oriented and structured individual who takes initiative and thrives in a role with many points of contact. You are motivated by responsibility and enjoy making a real impact in the projects you lead.



**We are looking for someone who has:**



* Completed and launched several automotive projects
* A B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Product Development or equivalent
* Experience participating in the procurement of complete systems or components
* Solid knowledge of the VPDS product development process and familiarity with tools such as KDP, Teamcenter, etc.
* Specific expertise within interior systems (e.g., injection-moulded plastics, comfort systems, sheet metal design) is highly meritorious

At Sigma Industry, you'll work at the forefront of technology together with engaged colleagues. We offer an environment where you’ll have the opportunity to grow, contribute, and take on exciting challenges – every single day.



**WHAT DO WE OFFER?**



As an employee with us, you get the best of both worlds – the variety and stimulation of working in different assignments and industries, with the security of one employer. We deliver cutting-edge expertise in areas such as Product Development, UX & Design, PLM, Industrial IT, Production Engineering and Project Management. You may work onsite with our clients or from our vibrant office located in the heart of Lindholmen Science Park.



We believe in doing things together and maintaining a healthy balance between work and leisure. Whether it's after-work gatherings, events, workout sessions, skiing trips or inspiring talks – we love finding ways to connect. We’ve made many great memories together, most recently on a trip to South Africa to celebrate our 10th anniversary as a consulting company!



We also prioritize continuous learning. In addition to opportunities for development through your assignments and technical training, we offer internal programs focused on personal growth.



We strongly believe that autonomy, inclusion, and influence are key drivers for motivation and success. Many of our employees have chosen Sigma because we share this perspective on career, life, and the future. Who you are matters just as much as what you do – and we aim to create a space where you can grow and thrive alongside our clients.

As part of the Sigma Group, we offer the best of both worlds – the stability of a large company and the agility of a smaller one.



We’re the “small company within the big Sigma,” made up of several specialized entities within various technical fields. Today, we are over 5,000 employees operating in 14 countries, making us Sweden’s largest privately owned consulting group.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer - Defense Industry
description:

***Are you constantly looking forward and pushing the boundaries of what is technically possible? Are you curious and innovative, eager to continue developing in product development? Then you might be the one we're looking for.***


We are now seeing a great demand for design engineers in the defense industry. We are searching for someone with previous experience designing in PTC Creo who wants to continue growing.



As a design engineer, you will be responsible for designing and developing your technical area as part of a cross-functional team. You will work closely with team members and other design engineers responsible for adjacent components. The role also includes participating in concept studies and improvement efforts as well as communication with suppliers.



**PERSONALITY AND COMPETENCE**



We are looking for someone who enjoys working in project-based environments, both in teams and individually, and can communicate confidently, clearly, and effectively. You are committed and strive to deliver your best. You are attentive to the needs of the customer/project and can quickly adapt to the culture. You have a strong interest in technology and possess good knowledge in Creo.



**EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS**



* B.Sc or M.Sc in Mechanical Engineering, Product Development, or similar.
* Preferably a few years of experience as a design engineer.
* Experience with PTC Creo.
* Previous experience from similar industries is meritorious.
* Good knowledge of both Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


**WHO ARE WE?**



As an employer, we are known for our personal atmosphere and culture of openness, involvement, and high energy. We enjoy doing things together and strive for a good balance between work and leisure. This includes after-work events, activities, training, trips, or inspirational lectures.



Professional development has always been important to us. In addition to opportunities for development in your consulting assignments and technical training, we have internal programs for personal growth. "Flow by Sigma" is a program focusing on work-life balance, setting and achieving personal goals, and managing change. We also have a mentorship program that starts every year with several mentors and mentees. We offer LinkedIn Learning licenses for those interested in self-paced digital studies.



**At Sigma Industry West**, we consider our employees to be our most important asset. We deliver expertise in product development, UX, industrial IT, embedded systems, production technology, and project management. We offer both on-site consultants and project-based work from our local offices. Our services cover everything from the first product sketch to manufacturing.



As a consultant with us, you will have the opportunity to explore various industries and technology areas. You will participate in and lead projects at the cutting edge of technology, developing products for a better tomorrow. Our clients are world-leading product companies in various sectors, with the majority in the automotive industry in Western Sweden.



Since our founding in 2014, we have experienced remarkable growth. Together with our subsidiaries Sigma Embedded Engineering and Sigma Energy & Marine, we are now over 300 employees. We also have a presence in the USA and Norway.

As part of the Sigma Group, we offer the best of both worlds: stability and entrepreneurial spirit. Sigma consists of several companies in different technical areas of expertise and currently has over 3,500 employees operating in 11 countries, making us Sweden's largest privately-owned consulting group.

title: Product Designer
description:
We develop and manufacture turnkey energy storage solutions, based on lithium-ion battery technology. Our goal is to engineer technology that both stores and optimizes energy as we shift towards more efficient energy usage and renewable energy sources on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with exceptional engineers, scientists, developers and more to pave the way for the next big leap in the energy industry through our battery energy storage and optimization systems.***Location; Stockholm***

 **The Role**

  

As a Product Designer at Polarium, you will take a leading role in shaping the user experience across our growing ecosystem of digital energy offerings—including EMS, VPP, Fleet management and related mobile apps.  

  

You’ll work at the intersection of design and development, connecting product vision, user needs, and technical implementation to deliver intuitive, scalable, and branded user experiences.  

  

We’re looking for a hybrid profile: someone who can own UX and UI design across multiple products and contribute directly to frontend implementation. You’ll collaborate with product management, developers, and other stakeholders to deliver design solutions that are both elegant and functional—while contributing to a shared design system that scales across Polariums digital presence.  

  

This is a strategic and hands-on role for a designer who thrives in high-impact environments where design directly affects product success, usability, and business value.**Responsibilities**

  

* Lead the end-to-end product design process across key digital touchpoints, from discovery to delivery
* Transform user needs and product goals into intuitive flows, wireframes, and UI designs
* Develop and maintain a scalable, consistent design system and component library
* Collaborate with frontend developers and implement UI designs using modern frontend frameworks (e.g., React or similar)
* Ensure consistent, brand-aligned experiences across digital touchpoints
* Validate designs through continuous user feedback, usability testing, and iterative improvements
* Balance short-term delivery needs with long-term UX vision and scalability
* Partner with product manager to refine, prioritize, and improve CX

**Qualifications and experience**

  

* 3+ years of experience as a Product Designer or UX/UI Designer in a digital product environment
* Strong portfolio showcasing both UX thinking and high-quality UI execution
* Hands-on experience with Figma (or similar) for wireframing, prototyping, and component design
* Proficiency in frontend development using frameworks like React or similar
* Experience designing for complex systems (e.g. dashboards, control interfaces, data-rich UIs)
* Ability to drive consistency across multiple products through design systems or shared components
* Collaborative mindset with strong communication skills—able to work closely with engineers and PM
* Energy/IoT domain knowledge is a plus, but not required
* Fluent in English, both written and verbal.

**We offer**

  

* Wellness contribution
* Five extra flexibility days
* Pension

Kindly as we are unable to accept any applications via email in compliance with the GDPR regulations.  

At Polarium, creating change in the energy industry starts with our team. We believe a diverse workplace brings creativity, innovation and better represents our customers, and the many communities they serve, around the world. A positive work-life balance is what supercharges our teamwork and a sustainable personal journey throughout our careers.  

Since Polarium launched in 2015, we’ve been on a mission to redesign the energy industry. We’re unlocking the massive potential of energy storage systems through our wide range of intelligent and digital services. Our passion for solving challenges is what drives our next generation of premium energy storage products in use on all continents and in all climate zones. Today, we power businesses, optimize energy usage, and reduce carbon dioxide emissions to create a cleaner future in energy.  

We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Product Manager Database Observability (Remote, NASA/EMEA)
description:
**This is a remote opportunity and we would be interested in applicants from European time zones only at this time.**


### **About Grafana Labs**



Grafana Labs provides an open and composable monitoring and observability platform built around Grafana, the leading open source technology for dashboards and visualization. There are more than 20M users of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a SpaceX launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies—including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay—manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack.


### **About Product Management**



As a Product Manager at Grafana Labs, you'll develop a vision and strategy for your product domain. You will own your product’s roadmap, collateral, and market research, and you will collaborate with Grafana leadership on fine-tuning your product’s goals. You will be the primary advocate and expert in your area, with a strong ability to communicate needs, functionality, and details effectively both to external customers and internal stakeholders. The teams and people you will be interacting with will be 100% remote and globally distributed, so strong and proactive communication is essential.



Product Managers are the bridge that connect Engineering, Design, and UX to GTM. You are a facilitator who ensures the free flow of information across these teams and are expected to be technically proficient when representing our products to our customers.


### **The Role**



As the **Product Manager for Database Observability (DB O11y)** you’ll be responsible for our Cloud-exclusive database monitoring product. DB O11y provides our customers with deep, actionable insights into their database environments. This product enables applications developers and database admins to surface, troubleshoot, and optimize latency problems and slow running queries across the critical database infrastructure that underpins a company’s core business applications.



In your role as Product Manager (PM), you’ll be paired with a lead PM. Together, your ultimate responsibility will be to ensure the long-term success of DB O11y through collaboration with your engineering counterparts. The DB O11y product is currently in Private Preview and in early testing with a few select customers. The most critical, immediate short-term goal is to validate the core customer problems to ensure that the solution we’re building meets their use cases. Together with your lead PM, you’ll also be putting together and finalizing packaging and pricing proposals as we work towards a full launch.



In addition to external requirements, you’ll also be working with other teams across the Observability department to ensure the DB O11y experience is tightly woven into our overall Grafana Cloud suite of products. This means integrating the product into the Asserts knowledge graph so that our customers have a seamless monitoring experience where they can easily navigate between different layers of their architecture as they triage issues using our product.



As a Product Manager at Grafana Labs, you will:


* Transform ideas and feedback into a product vision and roadmap
* Empathize with customer problems in order to collect user needs, requirements, and pain points
* Curate and properly represent user feedback to Engineering, while providing evidence to support tradeoffs and priorities
* Work closely with PMM to enable GTM on product differentiation, including creating and updating presentations, documentation, website content, datasheets, and whitepapers.
* Use your deep product expertise to make decisions about our go-to-market strategies, pricing, packaging, licensing and tiering

### **We’re excited about you because you have:**


* A BS/BA in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent work experience
* 3+ years of experience in Product Management
* 3+ years of experience in a B2B SaaS product
* Experience using or building observability products and/or developer tools, either internally as an SRE or for external customers
* Experience with open source software and/or commercial open source companies
* Experience working with engineering teams to design and build products in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

### **Bonus Points**


* Experience with OpenTelemetery protocols, receivers, and exporters
* Experience as a DBA or running, provisioning, managing relational databases
* Experience using or building agents, telemetry collectors, or related tools and services
* Experience partnering with UX to build delightful features with solid designs


In Sweden, the base compensation range for this role is SEK 654,000 - SEK 817,000. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here.


* *Compensation ranges are country-specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.*
  


**About Grafana Labs:** There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies - including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay - manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).  



**Equal Opportunity Employer:** At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.

*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our* *privacy policy**.*
company_description: Grafana Labs is the company behind Grafana, the leading open source software for visualizing time series data.

title: EA/Koncernarkitekt till E-hälsomyndigheten
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala myndighet? Vi söker en strategisk och drivande koncernarkitekt som vill leda utvecklingen av vår enterprisearkitektur och göra skillnad för samhällsnyttan.
  
  

Om tjänsten
  
Tjänsten innebär att agera som koncernarkitekt inom myndigheten, med ansvar för att leda och utveckla myndighetens arbete inom enterprisearkitektur. Du kommer att vara en del av myndighetens koncernarkitekturfunktion och bidra till utvecklingen av myndighetens arkitekturramverk, it-strategi och tillhörande tillämpningsanvisningar. I rollen ingår att ge stöd till myndighetens verksamhetsavdelningar i frågor som rör ramverk och metodik samt att säkerställa att beslutade strategier och riktlinjer följs. Du förväntas även ge stöd i kravprocessen och säkerställa att kravställningen översätts till välgrundade arkitekturprinciper och lösningsförslag som bidrar till en sammanhållen och hållbar utveckling av myndighetens verksamhet och it-landskap. Du kommer att ingå i en tvärfunktionell enhet som jobbar tillsammans för att stödja myndighetens övergipande strategiska mål och förflyttingar.
  
  

Om avdelningen
  
Avdelningen digital strategi och plattform ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor inom arkitektur, it-/informationssäkerhet, UX, portföljhantering, plattformsförmågor, drift, support och digital arbetsplats. Enheten digital strategi, där tjänsten är placerad, fokuserar på strategisk planering och rådgivning med ansvar för myndighetens långsiktiga planering och digitala transformation.
  
  

Om dig
  
Vid rekryteringen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper, då de är avgörande för hur du kommer att trivas och lyckas i rollen. Du är en strukturerad och självgående person som arbetar strategiskt och har ett brett perspektiv på komplexa frågor. Med din helhetssyn kan du identifiera långsiktiga lösningar som skapar värde för hela organisationen. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och bidrar till gemensamma mål med ett lösningsfokuserat arbetssätt.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

* akademisk utbildning som civilingenjör, systemvetare eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* flerårig erfarenhet av arbete med it-arkitektur
* erfarenhet av modelleringsnotationer som Archimate och Unified Modeling Language (UML) och relevanta verktyg
* förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska
* förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på engelska


**Det är meriterande för tjänsten om du har:**  

* erfarehet av arbete i enterprise-/koncernarkitekturfunktion där organisationens strategi och riktning realiseras arkitekturellt
* certifiering(ar) inom arkitektur
* erfarenhet av förmågemodellering
* erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete i portföljstyrning


Vad erbjuder vi?
  
Vi är en myndighet i tillväxt. E-hälsomyndigheten erbjuder dig att vara med och skapa samhällsnytta. Vi arbetar med stora transaktionskritiska system som påverkar samhället, till exempel e-recept och Läkemedelskollen.
  
  

Hos oss kommer du att omges av trevliga och kompetenta arbetskamrater, på en myndighet med ett flertal viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
  
  

På E-hälsomyndigheten har alla medarbetare förtroendearbetstid och möjlighet att arbeta delvis på distans. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: Jobba hos oss
  
  

Är du intresserad?
  
  

**Frågor angående tjänsten besvaras av:**  

**Enhetschef Johan Palmqvist:** 010-106 07 26
  
  

**Frågor angående rekryteringsprocessen besvaras av:**  

**HR-specialist Gabriela Plachecka:** gabriela.plachecka@ehalsomyndigheten.se
  
  

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan och cv via vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den 4 augusti 2025. Ladda upp examensbevis, betyg och intyg som är relevanta för tjänsten i samband med din ansökan. Rekryteringsprocessen kommer att återupptas i augusti. Observera att under sommarperioden kommer vi ha begränsad möjlighet att svara på telefon och mail.
  
  

Urvalsfrågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara urvalsfrågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett. Det är därför viktigt att du svarar tydligt och utförligt på urvalsfrågorna och inte hänvisar till
  
  

Anställningen är tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort för anställningen är Stockholm eller Kalmar. Arbetet kan innebära tjänsteresor, främst mellan dessa två orter.
  
  

En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. Därför kan vi komma att behöva genomföra en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). För en del arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
  
  

Om du har beslut om skyddade personuppgifter, kontakta den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen.
  
  

Om E-hälsomyndigheten
  
E-hälsomyndigheten driver utvecklingen av den nationella digitala infrastrukturen inom hälsa, vård och omsorg. Vi skapar förutsättningar för digitala tjänster och lösningar för privatpersoner och professioner inom hälso- och sjukvård, apotek och socialtjänst. Vi arbetar för att hälsodata ska bli tillgängliga i hela vårdkedjan, oavsett var individer får vård.
  
  

Hos oss arbetar cirka 500 medarbetare fördelat på två orter, Kalmar och Stockholm. Läs mer om oss på www.ehalsomyndigheten.se
  
  

Rekryteringen sköts av E-hälsomyndighetens HR-enhet och vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.

title: EA/Koncernarkitekt till E-hälsomyndigheten
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala myndighet? Vi söker en strategisk och drivande koncernarkitekt som vill leda utvecklingen av vår enterprisearkitektur och göra skillnad för samhällsnyttan.
  
  

Om tjänsten
  
Tjänsten innebär att agera som koncernarkitekt inom myndigheten, med ansvar för att leda och utveckla myndighetens arbete inom enterprisearkitektur. Du kommer att vara en del av myndighetens koncernarkitekturfunktion och bidra till utvecklingen av myndighetens arkitekturramverk, it-strategi och tillhörande tillämpningsanvisningar. I rollen ingår att ge stöd till myndighetens verksamhetsavdelningar i frågor som rör ramverk och metodik samt att säkerställa att beslutade strategier och riktlinjer följs. Du förväntas även ge stöd i kravprocessen och säkerställa att kravställningen översätts till välgrundade arkitekturprinciper och lösningsförslag som bidrar till en sammanhållen och hållbar utveckling av myndighetens verksamhet och it-landskap. Du kommer att ingå i en tvärfunktionell enhet som jobbar tillsammans för att stödja myndighetens övergipande strategiska mål och förflyttingar.
  
  

Om avdelningen
  
Avdelningen digital strategi och plattform ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor inom arkitektur, it-/informationssäkerhet, UX, portföljhantering, plattformsförmågor, drift, support och digital arbetsplats.
