title: IT-support
description:
Vill du vara en viktig del av Decernos IT-supportteam och samtidigt få arbeta med både människor och teknik i en föränderlig miljö? Då kan det vara dig vi söker!
   

  

**Vad gör vi?**
 Vi på Decerno är specialister på skräddarsydda digitala lösningar och är stolta över att våra uppdrag bidrar till samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Det betyder att vi förstår att alla kunder är olika och har unika förutsättningar. Vi skräddarsyr våra lösningar utefter kundens behov vilket medför att vi kan erbjuda våra medarbetare ett smörgåsbord av spännande projekt och tekniker.
   

  

 Samtidigt som vi skapar digitala lösningar vill vi också göra skillnad på riktigt. Det är inte bara något vi säger, vi menar det! Sedan vår start 1984 har vår etiska policy varit vår kompass och vi väljer aktivt bort projekt inom vapenindustri, spel om pengar, tobak och alkohol.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som IT-support hos oss kommer du huvudsakligen att arbeta med support och drift av våra interna IT-miljöer – det vill säga våra virtuella servrar, utvecklingsmiljöer samt molntjänster. Du kommer även att hjälpa till med administration av nya användare, datorer och licenser. Du blir en del av ett litet team på två personer och rapporterar direkt till IT-chefen.
   

  

 Utöver det tekniska ansvaret kommer du också att spela en viktig roll i att välkomna nya kollegor – därför värdesätter vi att du är social, hjälpsam och tycker om att få andra att känna sig trygga och välkomna redan från dag ett. Du drivs av nyfikenhet och har en naturlig envishet när det gäller att lösa problem, du ger dig inte förrän alla har den IT-miljö de behöver för att kunna arbeta effektivt och smidigt.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringen är på vårt kontor i Stockholm, och vi ser därför gärna att du bor inom pendlingsavstånd för att kunna vara på plats vid behov.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, alternativt likvärdig utbildning eller tidigare erfarenhet av liknande roll
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av arbete inom IT
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med VMware och Microsoft Windows
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Office 365 och Azure
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och goda kunskaper i engelska


 Det är meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Azure DevOps, Infrastructure as Code eller ISO27001.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du är social och trivs i en roll där du får hjälpa och bemöta människor, särskilt nya medarbetare. Du har ett gediget teknik- och säkerhetsintresse och är dessutom prestigelös och ansvarstagande.
   

  

**Därför ska du välja Decerno**
 I våra medarbetarundersökningar blir det gång på gång tydligt att det är de fantastiska kollegorna, de roliga och utmanande projekten och möjligheten att kunna bidra till samhällsnytta som gör att våra medarbetare trivs så bra på Decerno.
   

  

 Sedan finns det också några ytterligare aspekter vilka vi ser som självklarheter:
   

  

* En flexibel arbetsplats med större frihet att planera vardagen för att få arbete och privatliv att gå ihop
* Extra föräldraförmåner eftersom vi tycker att familjen är viktigast
* Ett fräscht nybyggt kontor i Stockholm med tillgång till eget gym, cykelgarage och takterrass
* Vi tycker att din kompetensutveckling är viktig! Därför anordnar vi interna utbildningar löpande i vår egen Dec Academy, gör satsningar inom AI, håller i bokcirklar och arrangerar årliga konferenser
* Vi vill att du ska må bra, trivas och ha roligt på arbetet och därför arrangerar vi regelbundet olika sociala aktiviteter, utmaningar och hälsotävlingar – såväl virtuellt som på plats
* Utöver detta erbjuder vi även ett brett förmånspaket som inkluderar bland annat friskvårdsbidrag och ett generöst försäkringspaket. Vi berättar gärna mer om du vill veta vad mer vi på Decerno skulle kunna erbjuda dig.


**Låter detta som din nästa utmaning?**
 Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi intervjuar löpande!
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Klara på
 **klara.zetterberg@decerno.se**

title: IT Support Specialist
description:
*We are looking for an IT Support Specialist to join SEB Embedded!* 




*Join us in ensuring that SEB Embedded runs smoothly by providing hands-on IT support across our organization. You will be a key player in maintaining and improving our internal tooling and systems, empowering our teams to do their best work every day.* 




  





**About the team** 




 You will be part of the Platform Engineering team, but support the full SEB Embedded Organization enabling everyone to operate at their best. We support our colleagues across domains by ensuring their tools and systems are efficient, secure, and well-integrated. You and your closest colleague will work together in a proactive, helpful way, driven by a shared mission to create a seamless digital workplace.
 



  





**What you will do** 




 You will provide day-to-day IT support for employees across the company, primarily on macOS and Google Workspace. We work with a modern IT environment based on macOS, Google Workspace, and the Atlassian suite. This is a service-oriented role, perfect for someone early in their career, who’s eager to take ownership, solve problems, and grow with us.
 



  





 Some of the things you will do:
 


* Administer and troubleshoot tools like Google Workspace, Atlassian (Jira, Confluence), and other cloud-based services.
* Set up and configure software and user accounts for new and existing employees.
* Maintain and improve internal documentation and processes related to IT support.
* Work closely with other teams to identify needs, propose solutions, and continuously improve our IT environment.
* Help develop solutions to improve IT efficiency.



  





**Who you are** 




 You’re someone who enjoys helping others, solving problems, and working hands-on with technology. You are self-motivated, service-minded, and not afraid to take initiative or explore new solutions. You communicate clearly and confidently with both technical and non-technical users.
 



  





 Key ingredients to succeed in this role:
 


* 1–2 years of experience in a similar IT support role.
* Comfortable working in a macOS environment.
* Hands-on experience with Google Workspace administration.
* Service-oriented mindset with strong communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and drive tasks to completion.
* Nice to have: Experience with Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence).



  





**What we offer** 




 We believe in a healthy work-life balance meaning we encourage a hybrid set-up that puts emphasis on flexibility and autonomy. Your unique talents and skills are important to us, therefore we want you to thrive in your development and have the chance to grow within the organization in a way that resonates with your aspirations.
 



  





 We offer the best of both worlds; the stability and security of an established company together with the innovation and energy of a scale-up. As part of your journey, working alongside exceptional colleagues, we want to make sure to nurture your skills while you contribute to our collective success!
 



  





**Application** 




 With summer vacations approaching, we will begin reviewing applications in August.

title: Head of Customer Service
company_industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
***Karo Healthcare***
*, a dynamic and growing personal-care retail company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.*




 Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a
 **Head of Customer Service, International** 
 for our office in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   




**What's in it for you?**

**A rare opportunity to build something from the ground up—your team, your way. You'll shape a global function in a growing, fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial mindset and strong international ambitions. This is your chance to make an impact across markets, be visible at senior levels, and accelerate your career in a highly dynamic setting.**



**What you'll be doing**
* Lead the creation of a new international Customer Service function, starting in the Nordics and scaling to other markets
* Define and implement a scalable global customer service strategy that supports B2B partners—pharmacies, wholesalers, and mass retailers
* Build and manage a high-performing team across multiple countries and time zones
* Own daily operations to ensure a seamless, responsive, and high-quality customer experience
* Act as the key connector between Customer Service, Commercial, Supply Chain, and Finance
* Develop and refine KPIs, tools, and service standards to ensure operational excellence
* Drive continuous improvements to elevate the customer journey and satisfaction
* Serve as the internal voice of the customer to support strategic business decisions
* Ensure compliance with contracts, pricing, product availability, and local regulations
* Champion digitalization and automation within the service function
* Promote knowledge-sharing and best practices across regions to ensure consistency
  

  


**Requirements**
* Proven track record in building and leading international Customer Service teams
* Deep understanding of B2B customer environments—experience in FMCG, healthcare, or pharma is highly valued
* Strong cross-functional collaborator, especially with Sales and Supply Chain
* Hands-on, structured, and solution-driven approach—you thrive in fast-paced, agile environments
* Confident working with data, KPIs, and systems (ERP/CRM), ideally IFS, SAP, or Salesforce
* Fluent in English and at least one Nordic language (preferably Swedish)
* Strong leadership and change management capabilities
* Comfortable operating across cultures and geographies in international organisations
  

  


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage
* Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
* Flexible schedule, hybrid model with the primary work place in the office, and life-work balance
* Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
* Very positive work environment in a dynamic, international, and motivated team
* Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values



  
 



   
 



*Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.*

title: Microsoft 365 Technical Specialist (3rd Line Support)
description:
We are seeking an experienced
 **3rd Line Support** 
 professional to provide expert-level technical support for our
 **Microsoft 365 environment.** 
 This role is critical to maintaining the stability, security, and performance of our digital workplace, especially in resolving complex issues that surpass the capabilities of our internal IT team.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Deliver 3rd line support for Microsoft 365, addressing advanced technical incidents and ensuring minimal disruption to business operations.
* Perform in-depth troubleshooting and root cause analysis across Microsoft 365 services, including Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, Teams, and Azure AD.
* Collaborate with IT leadership to advise on Microsoft updates, roadmap planning, and strategic platform optimization.

 **Power Platform** 
 solutions (Power Automate, Power Apps, and Power BI).

 **PowerShell** 
 to automate administrative tasks and streamline support operations.
* Document solutions, maintain knowledge bases, and mentor junior team members to uplift internal IT capabilities.



  





 Apply now if interested!

title: Copywriter
description:
**Job Description**
 WHAT YOU’LL DO
   

  

 As a Copywriter you'll translate, trans create and produce written content for different marketing and communication activities for 2 markets, Sweden and UK. You'll conceptualize, translate and write copy for different media channels, in close co-operation with our Content Coordinator.
   

  

  

  

 Your main responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
   

  

* Trans create global and regional communication to local market needs
* Writing copy for activities assigned to you
* Securing H&M's tone of voice
* Securing that copy is written, adapted and translated according to cultural and legal guidelines
* Co-operating with internal and external parties
* The role will also involve validating and ensuring consistent omni-channel communication across all touchpoints for the produced copy


**Who You’ll Work With**
 In this role, you will collaborate with multiple teams to ensure the successful expansion of the business. You will work closely with Content Coordinators and Copywriters within the Customer Activation Team providing key insights and recommendations.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* A degree in Copywriting, Journalism, Creative Writing, or similar
* A passion for language and written communication and at least 3 years of professional experience in similar positions
* A genuine fashion interest and experience from fashion copy and translation
* Full proficiency in written Swedish and English.
* The work lies mainly in curating and translating from English – Swedish copy


 And people who are…
   

  

* Meticulous in your way of working and have an eye for details
* Able to create copy at a high pace at high quality
* Flexible and open mindset and are a great team player


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

 WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE
   

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 JOIN US
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, apply by sending your application through the career site as soon as possible but no later than August 4th, 2025, and initiate the dialogue with your current manager.
   

  

 This is a full time permanent position. The position is based in our Regional Office in Stockholm and reports to Content Team Manager
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: IT Retail Specialist
description:
*Are you a tech-savvy problem solver with a passion for retail and digital innovation? We’re looking for a Retail IT Application Specialist to help shape the future in-store experience through smart system solutions and strong business collaboration.* 




  





  





**About the role** 




 We are looking for a proactive and experienced Retail IT Application Specialist to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be a vital link between business operations and technology, ensuring that our retail systems are efficient, reliable, and continuously improving. You will collaborate with stakeholders across the business, manage vendor relationships, oversee key integrations, and drive projects from concept to implementation — all while keeping the customer and store experience at the center.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with business units to understand operational needs and translate them into functional application requirements that align with broader business objectives.
* Vendor & Supplier Management: Manage external vendors and service providers to ensure SLA compliance, optimal performance, and cost-effective service delivery.
* Project Management: Lead application-related projects from start to finish, ensuring timelines, budgets, and scope are met while maintaining stakeholder alignment and risk mitigation.
* Continuous Improvement: Identify and implement enhancements that improve system efficiency, user experience, and business impact. Keep documentation of system configurations and workflows updated.
* Incident Management: Handle critical system incidents, analyze patterns to identify root causes, and implement sustainable solutions to reduce recurrence.
* Retail System Integration: Oversee integrations supporting retail operations, ensuring system performance and collaborating with technical teams to proactively resolve issues.
* Hands-on Retail IT Support: Provide functional support for retail systems including POS, inventory management, and payment solutions.



  





  





**Profile** 



* At least 5 years of IT experience, preferably in Retail IT within the fashion industry.
* Proven track record in solution implementation and development projects, supported by a relevant academic background in IT.
* Hands-on experience with POS systems and a solid understanding of retail operations, including inventory and payment systems.
* Strong skills in SQL Server, including writing and troubleshooting queries.
* Familiar with data exchange methods such as SFTP, APIs, and flat files.
* Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and critical thinking abilities across platforms (Windows and iOS).
* A collaborative, communicative, and organized team player who thrives in a fast-paced, global environment.



  





  





 Apply with your CV in English by 2025/07/31. Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today! Please note that this position may be filled before the set end date.
 



  





**About GANT** 




 GANT stands as an emblem of American Sportswear, symbolizing timeless style and innovation across 70+ global markets. As a company, we blend heritage with contemporary flair, crafting apparel for the bold, the curious, and the imaginative. Our brand represents more than fashion; it's a tradition of excellence and authenticity. As an employer, we foster a culture of continuous learning and creativity, inviting high performers to join our diverse team of innovators. At GANT, we're not just shaping the future of fashion; we're redefining what it means to dress with purpose and passion.

title: Cyber Security IAM Project Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a IAM Project Manager, you will be leading the implementation, management, and monitoring of security measures across software, services, and IAM technology. With advanced knowledge of cybersecurity principles, you will ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of organizational assets. Together with senior stakeholders, including project and product teams, you will ensure that security is integrated into the development and operational processes. As part of a strategic security initiative, you drive the ongoing evolution of security processes, strengthen data protection efforts, and ensure that best practices are implemented across the organization’s technology platforms and services.
   

  

* Project Management & Follow-up: Develop plans, track progress, ensure delivery, and maintain project documentation
* IAM Strategy & Compliance: Enforce IAM policies, update systems based on business needs and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Risk Management & Security: Assess and mitigate risks to ensure the effectiveness and security of the IAM system.
* Stakeholder & Communication Management: Maintain transparent communication, manage changes, and collaborate with key stakeholders.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You will belong to our Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering team and be part of our sub-team called IAM Center of Excellence. The team’s scope of responsibility covers aspects from demand management to planning and prioritisation, while also assisting at the unit level by supporting Architecture and Engineering teams with strategic planning and alignment. We are set up to provide the organisation with a single point of contact for any IAM related matter within H&M.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Experience planning, leading, and following up on IAM and cyber security projects.
* Strong risk analysis skills
* Knowledge of implementation, regulatory frameworks, and standards (e.g., DORA, NIS).
* Solid project coordination and stakeholder management abilities
* A track record of driving technical and operational security initiatives
* Proficiency with Atlassian tools like Jira and Confluence


*And people who are…*
* Excited about Cyber Security
* Forward-thinking and have a strategic mindset
* Encouraging open and constructive discussions.
* Structured and organized, with the ability to manage complexity and keep projects on track
* Strong communicators who can engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders and drive collaboration across teams


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound.
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial environment where your insights directly influence strategic decisions.
* A collaborative culture that values innovation, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is a hybrid position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Unfortunately relocation is not offered for this role.**
 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here!
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Customer Care Coordinator
company_industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
***Karo Healthcare***
*, a dynamic and growing personal-care retail company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.*




 Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a
 **Customer Care Coordinator** 
 for our office in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   




**What's in it for you?**

**Be at the heart of our customer operations, in a hands-on role with real impact.**
 You'll join an agile, international company in growth mode—where your work shapes the daily experience of our customers and retail partners across the Nordics. Expect collaboration across borders, exposure to multiple business functions, and the chance to grow your career in a fast-paced, purpose-driven environment.
   




**What you'll be doing**
* Be the go-to contact for our pharmacy and retail customers in the Nordics—resolving order-related questions and ensuring timely communication.
* Monitor orders and coordinate with internal teams to ensure smooth, on-time deliveries.
* Send order confirmations and manage inquiries with precision and speed.
* Proactively communicate stock availability, delivery delays, and provide solutions.
* Work closely with supply chain, logistics, and commercial teams to remove roadblocks and boost customer satisfaction.
* Handle complex inquiries and escalations with a structured, customer-first approach.
* Log and follow up on customer cases, supporting ongoing improvement efforts.
* Support customer-specific processes including campaigns, promotional deliveries, and tailored reporting.
* Share customer insights internally to help improve product availability and service levels
  

  


**Requirements**
**Requirements**
* 2-3 years of experience in customer service, order management, or supply chain—ideally from a fast-moving, product-driven environment.
* Comfortable navigating ERP systems (IFS, SAP, Navision, or similar).
* Fluent in both
 **English and Swedish** 
 .
* Confident using
 **Excel and Outlook** 
 as daily tools.
* Previous experience in
 **FMCG, healthcare, or pharma** 
 is a strong plus.
* You're structured, solutions-focused, and enjoy working with multiple stakeholders to deliver results.
  

  


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage
* Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
* Flexible schedule, hybrid model with the primary work place in the office, and life-work balance
* Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
* Very positive work environment in a dynamic, international, and motivated team
* Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values



  
 



   
 



*Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.*

title: Spontanansökan
description:
Spontanansökan var med och forma Sveriges säkraste IT-miljöer!
   

  

 Hittar du ingen ledig tjänst som matchar just dig?
   

  

 Skicka in en spontanansökan till oss. Vi letar alltid efter fler passionerade talanger som delar vår vision: att skapa ett IT-tryggare Sverige.
   

  

 Vi sparar din ansökan för framtida behov och kontaktar dig när en matchande möjlighet dyker upp.
   

  

 Vill du bli en del av något större?
   

  

 På IT-Total välkomnar vi dig som brinner för att ligga i framkant när det gäller säker IT-infrastruktur, molntjänster, datacenter, NOC/SOC, automation, virtualisering, nätverk och säkerhet.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar du tillsammans med några av branschens främsta experter i en inspirerande miljö där spetskompetens, säkerhet och nytänkande står i fokus.
   

  

 Vi vill vara platsen där du växer – där du kan utvecklas inom just de områden du brinner för. Tillsammans skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där vi delar kunskap, utmanar varandra och alltid strävar efter att hitta de bästa, mest kreativa lösningarna åt våra kunder.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill bli bäst på det just du brinner för
   

  

**Vi Värdesätter Dig Som**
* Är glad, utåtriktad och tycker om att bygga relationer
* Brinner för IT, säkerhet och teknik
* Vill lära dig nya färdigheter och driva IT-Total framåt
* Tänker nytt, hittar kreativa lösningar och älskar komplexa problem
* Har en bred grund inom IT-infrastruktur, säkerhet, moln eller nätverk


 Vad erbjuder IT-Total dig?
   

  

 Vi Skapades Ur Idén Att Bli Den Bästa Arbetsplatsen För Specialister Inom IT-infrastruktur, Säkerhet Och Moln. Här Väntar En Stimulerande Vardag Där Du Får
   

  

* 🥪 Himmelsk fredagsfrukost tillsammans med kollegorna
* 🌍 Hybrid arbetsplats – frihet mellan kontor, distansarbete och kund
* 💑 Roligt på jobbet – gemensam träning, resor, spelkvällar och mycket mer
* 🍏 Frukt, nötter, kaffe i världsklass (Kunglig Hovleverantör!) samt fredagsfika
* 🏡 Nära Mall of Scandinavia, Brunnsviken och grymma lunchpromenader
* ✔ Trygga anställningsvillkor och work–life balance på riktigt
* 🙌 Kollegor i världsklass som bryr sig 💛
* 🚗 Generösa parkeringsmöjligheter
* 🏌️‍♂️ Friskvårdsbidrag för din hälsa


 Vad händer när du ansökt?
   

  

 Vi sparar din ansökan och återkopplar när en tjänst som matchar din profil öppnas.
   

  

 Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?
   

  

 Tveka då inte att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare:
   

  

 Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total
   

  

 Mail: kajsa.jordansson@it-total.se
   

  

 Tel: 070 -729 19 82

title: IT-infrastruktur konsult till Pokayoke
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Redo för nästa steg i karriären, där du kombinerar din tekniska spets med djup förståelse för lager- och logistikverksamhet?
   

  

 Vi söker en IT-infrastrukturtekniker som vill arbeta konsultativt och vara med och utveckla framtidens IT-miljöer i Sveriges mest dynamiska bransch - Logistik!
   

  

 Det här är rollen för dig som älskar att lösa problem i verkligheten bland plockvagnar, scannrar, automatiserade flöden och avancerade nätverk och samtidigt vill vara den tekniska tryggheten bakom en stabil och skalbar driftmiljö.
   

  

**Din roll som IT-infrastrukturtekniker**
 Som konsult hos oss arbetar du nära våra kunder inom lager, logistik och 3PL i uppdrag som rör både teknikens detaljer och helhetens struktur. Du är inte bara den som löser problem när de uppstår, du är också rådgivaren som hjälper våra kunder att tänka långsiktigt kring sin IT- miljö.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Vara en teknisk rådgivare i frågor som rör val av infrastruktur t.ex. lokalt vs molnbaserat, hybridlösningar, serverstrategi, nätverksdesign eller klienthantering.
* Bygga upp governance-modeller för IT-drift hos våra kunder med tydliga riktlinjer för roller, ansvar, dokumentation, säkerhet och förändringsledning.
* Leda och genomföra migreringar från äldre plattformar till moderna lösningar, exempelvis flytt av servrar till molnet, modernisering av nätverksmiljöer, eller införande av centraliserad administration (t.ex. Intune, Azure AD).
* Stötta i förändringsarbeten där IT-infrastrukturen påverkas t.ex. vid etablering av nya lager, insourcing/outsourcing av IT-drift eller större organisationsförändringar.
* Delta i upphandling eller införande av nya system (t.ex. WMS eller automationslösningar) där du ansvarar för att IT- grunden är rätt planerad och dimensionerad.
* Samarbeta med andra konsulter inom WMS, integration och BI/Data för att se till att hela tekniska stacken fungerar!


 Du får kort sagt en nyckelroll i att forma kundens tekniska framtid med fokus på robusthet, skalbarhet och affärsstödjande IT.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

* Installera, konfigurera och underhålla IT-infrastruktur i lager- och logistikmiljöer
* Bygga nätverk (LAN/WLAN) för verksamheter med höga krav på stabilitet och täckning
* Stötta våra kunder i övergången till molnbaserade eller hybrida miljöer
* Automatisera återkommande processer inom exempelvis incident, service requests och change management.
* Bidra till effektivisering av IT-driften genom att bygga effektiv goveranance.
* Vara teknisk rådgivare i kundprojekt kopplade till WMS, TA-system, IoT och automation
* Agera nyckelperson i både löpande uppdrag och implementationsprojekt


**Vem är du?**
 Du är en tekniker med skarpa kunskaper men också en kommunikativ och problemlösande person.
   

  

 Du gillar miljöer där en incident inom IT verkligen får konsekvenser: Där ett nätverksavbrott betyder att lastbilar står still och där din lösning kan betyda skillnaden mellan kaos och flyt.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av IT-drift, gärna från 3PL/logistik eller industriell miljö
* God kunskap inom nätverk (switchar, accesspunkter, brandväggar), servrar (Windows/Linux) och klientmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av arbete i hybrid- eller molnmiljöer (Azure, AWS eller GCP)
* Vana av att jobba självständigt i kunduppdrag och projekt
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet av WMS-miljöer, automationslösningar, IT-stöd för 3PL eller IoT
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


****Placering och ansökan****
 Tjänsten är flexibel och du kan bo var som helst i Sverige. Resor i tjänsten förekommer i varierande grad beroende på uppdrag.
   

  

 Låter det intressant? Skicka din ansökan så snart som möjligt, urval sker löpande.
   

  

 Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Felicia Pettersson på fep@pokayoke.se
   

  

 Ansök nu och bli en del av ett företag som förändrar hur logistik utvecklas i Sverige.

title: Onsite Helpdesk Technician
description:
**About the Company** 




  





  





 Our world is hybrid. A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




  





  





 As an Onsite Helpdesk Technician, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring a highly autonomous, proactive, and efficient IT support environment. You will own the IT and AV experience in our office, proactively identifying and resolving issues independently, maintaining assets and services meticulously, and supporting our users with confidence and autonomy. You will be the only IT Helpdesk technician onsite, supported remotely by other team members, making independence and proactive problem-solving critical.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 




  





  




* **Autonomous User Support:** 
 Independently assist users with setting up and troubleshooting computers (Windows 11, macOS), phones (Android, iOS), and peripherals. Proactively identify issues in meeting rooms, workstations, and common spaces, resolving them swiftly and independently.
* **Proactive Workstation Maintenance:** 
 Ensure that all end-user workstations, screens, docking stations, peripherals, and cables are consistently operational. Regularly inspect and maintain equipment, preemptively addressing issues to prevent downtime.
* **Asset Management Expertise:** 
 Accurately manage IT and AV assets using asset management software (preferably Jira Asset Management, formerly Insight). Conduct regular audits, manage asset lifecycles, and ensure compliance with asset utilization policies.
* **Stock and Vendor Management:** 
 Purchase, manage, and maintain sufficient stock levels of hardware and peripherals. Coordinate warranty processes and RMAs with external vendors efficiently, ensuring timely resolutions and replacements as needed.
* **Consistent Onsite Availability:** 
 Serve as the primary onsite IT contact, available during office hours. Provide immediate and dependable support, maintaining high availability and responsiveness.
* **Technical Collaboration:** 
 Support engineering teams in troubleshooting and application management tasks, adhering strictly to security and compliance guidelines.
* **Onboarding and Offboarding Excellence:** 
 Execute efficient onboarding and offboarding processes, ensuring new hires have immediate access to necessary hardware and resources, and clearly communicating IT policies and best practices.
* **Executive Whiteglove Service:** 
 Deliver exceptional personalized support to executive management and directors, proactively ensuring their devices and peripherals experience minimal downtime and maximum productivity.
* **Team Collaboration and Escalation Management:** 
 Proactively collaborate with broader IT teams, understanding and following established SOPs and escalation procedures for ticket handling, incident management, and support prioritization, ensuring complex technical issues are efficiently escalated and resolved.
* **Documentation and Training:** 
 Independently develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for troubleshooting and operational procedures. Deliver training sessions to enhance user knowledge and independence in IT-related tasks.
* **Microsoft Teams Rooms and AV Maintenance:** 
 Maintain Logitech Teams rooms, ensuring they are regularly updated, patched, and reliably functioning. Conduct frequent checks proactively to ensure meeting environments are always prepared and operational.
* **AV and Studio Support:** 
 Acquire proficiency in Dante sound networks and OBS software, providing operational support for internal studio presentations and events, acting independently as a technical producer.
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role. Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager. Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group. Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you. Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





  





**Qualifications** 




  





  




* **Educational Background:** 
 IT-related education preferred; relevant certifications (e.g., MD-102) advantageous.
* **Experience:** 
 Proven experience in technical support/helpdesk environments. Demonstrated autonomy, proactiveness, and technical expertise are essential.
* **Technical Proficiency:** 
 Solid experience with:
* Windows 11, macOS, Android, and iOS
* Asset Management (preferably Jira Asset Management)
* MDM solutions (preferably Intune)
* M365 suite
* Basic understanding of Entra ID
* Ticketing systems (preferably Jira or ServiceNOW)
* AV equipment, specifically Logitech Teams Rooms
* Dante audio networks and OBS preferred
* 
* **Interpersonal Skills:** 
 Exceptional service abilities; strong communication skills; able to independently manage interactions with all organizational levels, clearly explaining technical information.
* **Organizational Excellence:** 
 Meticulous organizational and time management skills. Proven ability to independently manage asset tracking, audits, and prioritization.
* **Problem-Solving Ability:** 
 Demonstrated capability in independent troubleshooting and critical problem-solving, proactive in anticipating and mitigating potential issues.
* **Reliable Onsite Presence:** 
 Dependable and punctual, ensuring consistent onsite availability to provide immediate support.



  





  





**Pay range and compensation package** 




  





  





 This position is ideal for a technically proficient and proactive individual looking to leverage and expand their IT and AV experience in a challenging and dynamic environment, actively shaping the end-user technology experience.
 



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Statement:** 




  





  





 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.
 



  





 ```

title: Content Coordinator
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fueled by dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

 As a
 **Content Coordinator** 
 within the newly created RBU (Belgium, The Netherlands, Norway, Denmark, Sweden), you will play a pivotal role in managing and aligning content strategies for national and retail campaigns across a specific region. Reporting to the Content Section Manager, you will bridge the gap between central directives and local market requirements, ensuring a cohesive and impactful campaign execution. This role demands a 360° marketing approach, leveraging data-driven insights, collaboration with cross-functional teams, and fostering a spirit of teamwork within the content team.
   

  

**How you can contribute and have an impact?**
**Campaign Management & Localization:**
* Develop and implement 360° marketing campaigns (national and retail) in alignment with central strategies and guidelines.
* Brief external agencies to create assets that meet central input while addressing the unique needs of local markets.
* Localize assets to resonate with regional audiences, ensuring alignment with cultural and market-specific nuances.
* Monitor the implementation of campaigns from an assets perspective to ensure consistency and quality and budget overall follow up for all production of content and agencies Creative Development:
* Collaborate with the central creative team to adapt or develop region-specific creative ideas and content.
* Drive the development of innovative content solutions to address specific market challenges and opportunities.
* Accompany and coach the creative agency within the new set-up and way of working, ensuring that the brand's "Defy Ordinary" philosophy is applied at all stages of the creative process.
* Champion new formats, technologies, and storytelling techniques tailored to regional audiences.
* Ensure aligned co-agency briefing and content development (national, retail, CRM, SoMe).


**Data-Driven Localization:**
* Use data insights and market analytics to define local specifications for campaigns and content.
* Work closely with local sales teams and business analysts to tailor content strategies for optimal impact.
* Ensure that local market needs are protected while seeking synergies across multiple markets.


**Social Media Content Management:**
* Develop and maintain a regional social media content calendar, ensuring alignment with global strategies and local relevance.
* Oversee the localization and development of SoMe content, ensuring high engagement and brand consistency.


**Performance Monitoring & Optimization:**
* Track the performance of campaigns and content, using data to refine and optimize strategies.
* Ensure that all content aligns with brand guidelines and delivers measurable business results.


****What we look for:****
* Strong understanding of 360° marketing strategies, particularly in the automotive industry.
* In-depth knowledge of Nordic country-specific digital marketing channels, platforms, tools and best practices.
* Exceptional briefing and communication skills, with the ability to convey central input to agencies effectively.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and translate insights into actionable content strategies.
* Creativity and adaptability to develop bespoke content for diverse market needs.
* Collaborative approach with the ability to balance central directives and local requirements.
* Proficiency in social media management and content calendar planning.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in content management, campaign development, or marketing roles, preferably in the automotive sector.
* Experience managing external agencies and briefing on campaign development.
* Proven track record of creating and localizing multi-market campaigns.
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple stakeholders and deadlines.
* Fluency in English and a Nordic language (Norwegian, Swedish or Danish) is a must.


 This is an exciting opportunity to lead and shape the content strategy for a dynamic region in a global automotive brand. You will work at the intersection of creativity and data, collaborating with talented professionals across markets while making a tangible impact on localized marketing success.
   

  

 Note: This job description serves as a general overview of the responsibilities and requirements for the position of Content Coordinator. Duties may evolve and change over time, and additional tasks may be assigned as deemed necessary by the company.
   

  

 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Amsterdam Netherlands

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
**Join GlobalConnect as a Senior Network Engineer**
*Are you a Network and/or Systems Engineer looking to gain hands-on experience with secure SD-WAN/FW/LAN/WiFi overlay network platforms?*
*Are you already working with and wish to become even better in Fortinet, HPE Aruba, and Versa Networks SD-WAN, Firewall and LAN/WiFi technologies? And you might already have experience in managing large IP networks and you are eager to evolve your skill set by working with these platforms and solutions with great colleagues, then we have an opportunity for you!*
**About Us**
 We are a Nordic team of highly skilled technical specialists responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our extensive portfolio of software defined and centrally managed secure overlay network platforms. We boast one of the fastest-growing fiber networks in the Nordics, with services like WiFi Access, LAN Access, Firewalls, and SD-WAN in high demand. To keep pace, we're expanding our team with an experienced network specialist/engineer. Does that sound interesting?
   

  

 Our network plays a key role in the infrastructure in Scandinavia. To give it perspective, we cover more than 50% of Scandinavia’s internet connections including internet to hospitals, small, medium and big enterprise businesses, government functions, etc. Therefore, ensuring stability, security, and scalability of the network infrastructure will be super important and staying up to date with industry trends and new technologies to drive innovation and efficiency in the network environment.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As a Senior Network Engineer, you'll spearhead technical service development for managed services and collaborate with a team of dedicated and skilled colleagues to create scalable and dynamic solutions. We focus on your personal and professional development, and it is important for us that you have access to learning material and sparring with colleagues across the Nordics, as we know the importance of having fun at work while learning and developing your skills.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Interface with product management to align services with customer needs and best practices.
* Drive service development projects
* Develop and document services, ensuring platform ownership and life cycle management.
* Stay ahead of market trends and best practices.
* Lead design of platforms and technical solutions.
* Act as an expert, bridging organizational needs with suppliers.
* Ideally hands-on project experience working with SASE solutions.


**Why Join Us?**
 This is a social role with many internal contacts where you'll act as a knowledge sharer. Help lead the way in a constantly evolving network at one of Nordics' most expansive operators.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Skiftgående Servicedesk tekniker
description:
*vill du vara med och säkerställa att ett av Nordens största fibernät fungerar dygnet runt? Trivs du med problemlösning, teknik och varierande arbetstider? Då kan detta vara något för dig.*
**Om Rollen**
 I rollen som skiftgående Servicedesk tekniker får du en central plats i GlobalConnects vardag. Här jobbar du mitt i hjärtat av vår nätverksamhet – bokstavligen – med att se till att våra största kunder inom Carrier och hyperscale alltid får tillgång till stabil och snabb service. Du felsöker, supportar och dokumenterar ofta under tidspress och blir en viktig del i att hålla våra tjänster tillgängliga.
   

  

 Tillsammans med kollegor i Servicedesk hanterar du både stora och små ärenden, oavsett om det handlar om att svara på ett inkommande larm, lösa en teknisk incident eller skicka vidare ett ärende till rätt person. Du kommer oftast ha hjälp från en kollega under skiften, men det kan förekomma tillfällen där du arbetar själv.
   

  

 Det här jobbet passar dig som gillar struktur, trivs med variation och vill bidra till att våra tjänster håller hög kvalitet – oavsett tid på dygnet. Ingen dag är den andra lik, men varje dag spelar roll.
   

  

**Vad Du Kommer Göra**
* Supportera kunder, kollegor och underleverantörer via ärendehanteringssystemet
* Åtgärda kundincidenter vid larm eller avbrott
* Felsöka, hantera eskalationer och dispatcha ärenden för jämn arbetsfördelning
* Dokumentera och producera rapporter (RFO/RCA) vid större avbrott
* Bidra till att förbättra rutiner och processer i Servicedesk


**Välkommen till teamet!**
 Servicedesk Är Placerat i Stockholm På Solnavägen 3H, i Ljusa Och Moderna Lokaler. Vi Arbetar Skiftgående, Vilket Innebär Varierande Tider Och Arbetsmiljö. Skiften Ser Ut Så Här
   

  

* Blå: 06:45–15:15 (på plats)
* Röd: 15:00–23:00 (kan utföras på distans enligt den regel vi har idag)
* Grön: 22:45–07:00 (kan utföras på distans enligt den regel vi har idag)


 Tjänsten innebär att du till största delen jobbar tillsammans med en kollega under skiftet – men det kan förekomma tillfällen där du arbetar själv.
   

  

**För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du har:**
* Utbildning inom nätverk och telekommunikation – högskoleexamen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av kundsupport, helpdesk eller intern IT
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Kunskaper från Cisco-kurser (t.ex. CCNA eller högre) är meriterande


**Därför ska du välja GlobalConnect**
 Du blir en del av ett hjälpsamt och kunnigt team där vi stöttar varandra och samarbetar för att hålla Norden uppkopplat. Hos oss får du arbeta med några av våra största och mest samhällsbärande kunder inom Carrier och hyperscale-segmentet. Det är ett jobb med ansvar, men också med ett tydligt syfte – att bidra till att kritisk digital infrastruktur fungerar som den ska.
   

  

 Vi hjälper dig att komma in i rollen och ser till att du får en introduktion till våra system, tekniska miljöer och arbetssätt – och det finns alltid kollegor som gärna delar med sig.
   

  

**Låter Intressant?**
 Vi behöver inget personligt brev – om du inte har något du vill förklara som inte framgår av CV eller LinkedIn. Är du redan anställd på GlobalConnect? Perfekt – det här jobbet rekryteras just nu endast internt.
   

  

*Välkommen med din ansökan!*
**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Verification engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About This Opportunity**
 Step into a pivotal role at the forefront of 5G technology development. As a Verification Engineer on our RAN Performance team in Kista, you will be integral in shaping the quality and functionality of 5G Radio Access Network software. Our team works in a real end-to-end environment using real User Equipment (UE) and Core networks, providing a comprehensive and customer-focused setup. You’ll engage with system verification, test case automation, test analysis, and continuous improvement initiatives to ensure that our solutions exceed customer expectations.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Perform test analysis, prepare test environments, and troubleshoot faults to maintain high software quality.
* Develop and execute automated test cases as part of continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) processes.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and drive continuous improvements.
* Take initiative to work independently while sharing insights and findings to enhance team knowledge.
* Work within strict deadlines with a focus on delivering measurable results that impact product success.


**Skills You Bring**
* M.Sc. or B.Sc. degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent experience.
* Strong passion for learning new technologies, particularly in wireless communication systems and IP networking.
* Practical skills in cloud technologies, RF and RF tools, and software programming languages such as Java and Python.
* Knowledge or interest in generative AI and machine learning is a plus.
* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting capabilities.
* Effective communication skills in both English and Swedish, verbal and written.
* Ability to work well in a collaborative team environment while being self-driven and proactive.


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office.
   

  

 Last day to apply is 28th July . Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Lovina Rebeiro, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at lovina.rebeiro@ericsson.com
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

 768476

title: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)
description:
What we do at Qliro
   

  

 At Qliro, we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly, and highly competent people who together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both in Sweden and across the Nordics.
   

  

 What your team does
   

  

 As our Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), you will lead the Information Security and Risk Management (ISRM) team. Our mission is to protect Qliro’s assets while ensuring compliance with all legal requirements related to information security, risk management, and privacy. We operate in a fast-moving, agile environment and work closely with teams across Risk, Legal, Compliance, Tech and the broader organization to continuously enhance our security posture. You will report to our Chief Risk Officer.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Manage and coordinate the ISRM team and oversee Qliro’s information security strategy.
* Develop and maintain documentation, processes, and risk management frameworks for InfoSec governance.
* Lead Business Continuity Management, including impact assessments, continuity planning, and disaster recovery.
* Drive education and awareness programs to ensure security and privacy understanding at all levels, from employees to the Board.
* Oversee third-party risk management, including vendor onboarding and annual reviews.
* Act as the main contact for internal and external auditors and facilitate compliance with PCI DSS and GDPR.
* Assess security maturity and report to relevant stakeholders, including Board and executive management.
* Serve as an InfoSec stakeholder in various strategic initiatives, including cloud migration, vendor management, and privacy compliance.
* Lead the InfoSec committee and Privacy Forum, coordinating cross-functional security initiatives.
* Ensure implementation of technical and organizational privacy controls in compliance with GDPR.


 What you bring to the team
   

  

* 3-5 years of experience leading an InfoSec team or holding a senior InfoSec role (CISO or Head of InfoSec).
* Experience in the finance industry, preferably in a regulated environment.
* Strong knowledge of information security frameworks and certifications such as ISO27001, PCI DSS, CISA, or CISSP.
* A background in technology, such as IT auditing, development or IT operations, is highly beneficial.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey security concepts across all levels of the organization.
* Experience implementing security controls in cloud environments is a plus.
* A strategic mindset combined with a hands-on approach to problem-solving.


 WOW in everything we do
   

  

 We work hard to create a workplace that is diverse and inclusive, with employees from over 30 countries worldwide. We believe in the power of collaboration and empowering each other, and we strive to create a WOW experience in everything we do. Our future way of working is hybrid, combining time in the office with remote work. We see our office as a space for collaboration and creativity, where we bring out the best in one another.
   

  

 Does this sound like your next challenge? Apply now and join us on our journey!
   

  

*Qliro is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual* 
 orientation
 *or age.*

title: Network Development Engineer, InfraComms
job_function: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Engineering
description:
**Description**
 Amazon Web Services is looking for a highly motivated and technically savvy Network Development Engineer to help operate, develop and scale one of the world’s largest and most complex networks.
   

  

 Come join the InfraComms team within Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a Network Development Engineer (NDE).
   

  

 The InfraComms team within Amazon Web Services (AWS) is responsible for managing the communication, coordination, and operations related to external networks and carriers.
   

  

 The team maintains balanced partnerships with key industry stakeholders, leveraging their technical expertise to enhance the interconnectivity and availability of AWS's global network infrastructure.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of technical leadership and success in driving complex network related issues to resolution, autonomously and/or collaboratively.
   

  

 The successful candidate will demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of networking, networking concepts and theory. They will have experience proactively managing engineering projects, network optimization initiatives and operational network support for a large-scale service provider.
   

  

 As a technical leader, you will manage complex stakeholder operational issues, relationships and develop innovative mechanisms and solutions to enhance the interconnectivity and availability of AWS's global network infrastructure.
   

  

 A love for working with new technologies and pushing the envelope on existing technology is essential! This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world-class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies anywhere.
   

  

 AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
   

  

 You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 As an NDE in the InfraComms team, you will be responsible for:
   

  

 Handling both reactive and proactive operational issues related to AWS's external network services such as PNI, Public Peering, Transit, Embedd Caches, and Backbone.
   

  

 Engaging in advanced triaging for critical services and maintaining ownership of troubleshooting and communication.
   

  

 You will also enhance and develop mechanism to further improve AWS network processes for a better availability and connectivity.
   

  

**About AWS**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The InfraComms team is composed of experts in the internet ecosystem, with comprehensive knowledge of interconnectivity layers.
   

  

 The team operates on a 24x5 schedule across EU/NA/AP regions, ensuring a superior experience for AWS internal and external customers.
   

  

 You will be working alongside a diverse group of Network Development Engineers from the AMER, APAC, and EMEA regions.
   

  

 By joining the InfraComms team, you will play a crucial role in enhancing AWS's network operations and business development strategies, directly contributing to the improvement of internet infrastructure and the customer experience.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree from in Computer Science or related area.
* Experience with major routing protocols, specifically BGP.
* Experience of optical transport (passive and active Layer 1/WDM) operations and networks, auutomation via Bash/Shell scripting and Perl/Python programming.


**Preferred Qualifications**
 - Master’s degree from in Computer Science or related area -
   

  

* Experience in designing and operating large-scale, production networks.
* Experience in routing protocols, network operation and/ or implementation.
* Experience in fiber-optical network designing.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Data Services Sweden AB

title: Head of Account Management
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience—fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Reporting to the Commercial Director, you will form part of the department’s leadership team, helping shape the commercial strategy of foodora. You will be leading a team of team leads and individual Account Managers to manage overall vendor experience and drive business growth. These tasks include, but are not limited to:
   

  

**Your mission**
* Scale the team according to the growing portfolio of partnered brands, manage the team incentive schemes, identify the growth areas to motivate the team in achieving monthly targets
* Ideate and develop growth strategies through cross-functional collaboration e.g. top line growth through vendor commission and/or commercial terms renegotiation
* Maintain and monitor restaurant operational performance metrics to ensure portfolio compliance is aligned with company standards
* Be the local owner of the wide array of deals and promotions packages for partnered restaurants that includes sales and advertising revenue growth. Be involved in the end-to-end process of bringing deals live, including direct communication with restaurant partners when necessary
* Work with internal teams across departments to enhance vendor engagement and overall usage experience


 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

**Our recruitment process will include the following:**
 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Proven experience leading big sales/account management-related field or/and Team Leads
* Proven leadership ability, managing, motivate and execute within a fast-paced, aggressive target environment to meet both short- and long-term business objectives
* Prior experience from eCommerce and/or tech is considered a plus
* Track record of solid data analysis, understanding sales numbers and monitoring daily metrics to drive business process improvement
* Fluent in Swedish and English


 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**What’s in it for you?**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and insipring courses within Sana Labs.
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Application Architect
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of Telia operations and be at the heart of digital IT transformation?
   

  

 I’m
 **Irmantas Petrauskas** 
 , a leading Service Order Management and Activation team focused on building next-generation service orchestration across Telia footprint.
   

  

 Right now, we’re looking for a passionate and visionary
 **Application Architect** 
 to join our journey, with a focus on Service Order Management (SOM). This role is a key in designing systems that power seamless service delivery across mobile, fixed, and converged networks.
   

  

 Whether you're based in the Nordics or Baltics, if you have a deep understanding of telecommunication services, OSS applications and a passion for architecture, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 Join us and help define the architecture that drives tomorrow’s digital telco!
   

  

**As a Application Architect, you’ll...**
 You’ll be part of a distributed and international team, working in an agile environment at the forefront of Telia transformation. Our mission is to modernize and streamline service fulfillment and orchestration across mobile, fixed, and converged networks—leveraging technologies like catalog-driven orchestration, cloud-native platforms, and automation.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with other cross-functional BBS and OSS teams, as well as with leading vendors such as Ericsson.
   

  

 Your primary responsibility will be to serve as the
 **Application Architect** 
 across development initiatives and capabilities. You’ll ensure architectural consistency and technical excellence across the Service Order Management (SOM) landscape.
   

  

 This role includes, but is not limited to:
   

  

* Defining and maintaining a application and services architecture for Service Order Management.
* Leading design across projects, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture and TM Forum standards.
* Performing requirements analysis during features, and producing high- and low-level design documentation.
* Applying security-by-design principles and ensuring compliance with architectural governance.
* Acting as a technical liaison between internal teams and external vendors, ensuring quality and performance across the Service Order Management (SOM ) ecosystem.


**Who We're Looking For**
 We’re on a task to redefine how telecom services are delivered—faster, smarter, and more customer-centric. To succeed in this journey, we’re looking for someone who thrives in change, embraces complexity, and is passionate about building the next generation of OSS architecture.
   

  

 You are a forward-thinking problem solver who understands that behind every service order, there’s a customer experience that matters. You’re curious, analytical, and collaborative—someone who sees the big picture but also dives deep into technical detail. Whether you’re already an expert or aspiring to become one, you’re driven by a desire to shape how services are orchestrated, fulfilled, and managed across modern telecom networks.
   

  

 We’re open to both senior and junior profiles—what matters most is your passion for transformation and your willingness to grow into a technical leader in this space.
   

  

 Key Areas of Expertise We Value:
   

  

* Core OSS Domains: SOM (EOC, ECM), Inventory, Service orchestration, SIM/eSIM lifecycle management, TM Forum Open APIs, and catalog-driven orchestration.
* Architecture & Development: HLD/LLD documentation, system requirement analysis, roadmap planning, security-by-design, and integration.
* Platforms & Automation: Microservices, REST APIs, Kubernetes, CI/CD, cloud-native OSS, and automation frameworks.
* Ways of Working & Vendor Collaboration: Agile/SAFe methodologies, and experience working with vendors.


**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 18,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

*(For Lithuanian applicants only: Monthly salary range for this position in Lithuania: 4290 – 6435 EUR before tax deduction.)*
**Ready to make better happen?**
 We´re looking forward to your application by 07/27/2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email.
   

  

 Required background checks will be performed.
