* Work at the intersection of statistics, programming, and business, using tools like machine learning, data mining, and predictive modeling to analyze large datasets.
* Gather, clean, and process data, developing and training algorithms, and present findings in a way that is understandable and actionable for stakeholders.
* Helps both us and our partners to optimize processes, identify trends, and develop data-driven strategies for growth and innovation.



  





**We Believe That You** 



* Have at least 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist, preferably with a consulting background.
* A university degree in a highly technical and quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, Software Development, Engineering, or Economics).
* Proven experience in developing classification models using machine learning techniques.
* Proficiency with Python, SQL, and Git, along with a solid understanding of cloud computing concepts.
* Strong understanding of the theoretical foundations behind both classical and modern machine learning models and algorithms, such as generalized linear models, random forests, ensemble methods, and deep neural networks.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, both technical and non-technical. Strong skills in communication, organization, and teamwork, combined with solid business acumen.
* Thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you have the freedom to think and create on a large scale.
* Are committed to contributing to the company’s success and growth and have an entrepreneurial spark.



  





**Why Eghed?** 




 At Eghed, you won’t just get a job – you’ll get an opportunity to join a journey where you can make an impact and create real change. We are a team that values innovation, collaboration, and a healthy dose of fresh thinking. Here, you’ll have the space to grow both professionally and personally, and we look forward to hearing your ideas and visions for the future.

title: Manager – Cloud Technologies, Command & Control
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 We are on an exciting journey within cloud technology and AI, aiming to deliver products and services faster and more efficiently—ultimately benefiting our customers and Saab as a whole. In this role, you will be part of this transformation within Common C2 Tech, a unit within the Product Unit (PU) Command & Control (C2).
   

  

 As Manager of the Cloud section within Common C2 Tech, you will be involved in the development and implementation of cloud-based solutions for our C2 platforms across all domains within PU C2. You will be responsible for driving innovation and ensuring the successful delivery of modern and scalable C2 cloud capabilities.
   

  

 You will also lead a high-performing, cross-functional team consisting of engineers, developers and other specialists working with cloud technologies. Your focus will be to support, coach and create the right conditions for the team to thrive—both individually and as a group.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Participating in the development of new Multi-Domain C2 technology stack and solutions.
* Participating in championing of the adoption of cloud-native C2 solutions.
* Collaboration with Saab Common Tech Organisation in establishing and maintaining a robust Development Environment (DevSecOps).
* Collaborating with Product & System Management to define and execute common roadmap items
* Collaborating with section AI to identify possible benefits of AI-cloud solutions.
* Managing personnel, budgeting, and forecasting.


 Some travel may be required in this role.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 We are seeking a highly technical and experienced leader with a deep understanding of cloud technologies. You possess strong leadership skills and a proven ability to build and motivate teams. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills enable you to build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. You are driven by a passion for innovation and have the confidence to challenge conventions and push boundaries.
   

  

 Essential Skills and Experience:
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or a related field.
* A strong technical background with expertise in cloud technologies.
* Proven leadership experience in building and managing high-performing teams.
* Deep understanding of cloud architecture and development, including the underlying technical complexities.
* Deep understanding of end-user requirements and needs, preferably in the Defense sector.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.


 Experience of the following is positive:
   

  

* C2 or C5ISR systems
* Federated Mission Networking
* NATO frameworks and doctrines
* AWS, Google, Oracle or other hyperscalers
* IT security processes and technologies
* Disruptive communication solutions
* Kubernetes
* Docker
* Virtualization
* Large Language Models (LLMs)
* AI Agents
* GIS tools or technologies


 We value not only your skills and experience, but also place great importance on your personal qualities. We seek a collaborative individual who thrives in a team environment and actively contributes to a positive and supportive workplace culture.
   

  

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

title: Lead Solutions Architect
description:
REQ# FEQ326R286
   

  

 You will be the domain expert for Banking and Insurance (FSI) within
   

  

 Databricks Nordics, working in coordination with the Industry Leads
   

  

 within Databricks. In this role, you will set the vision, build
   

  

 executive relationships with customers and partners, and work with a
   

  

 cross-functional team across Databricks within Benelux. You must have
   

  

 a passion for how Data + AI will transform the FSI industry, be
   

  

 familiar with the unique challenges that global FSI companies face,
   

  

 and be effective at articulating your vision to audiences big and
   

  

 small.
   

  

 As a Trusted Technology Leader for our customer in the Banking and
   

  

 Insurance (FSI) vertical, you provide technology guidance and
   

  

 orchestrate the interaction between customer and Databricks resources
   

  

 to drive new opportunities, demand generation, digital transformation,
   

  

 and the mapping of industry/business scenarios to Databricks
   

  

 solutions. You ensure that Databricks is perceived as a technology
   

  

 leader & that our solutions (end-to-end) provide added value compared
   

  

 to the competition by being a trusted advisor to key decision-makers
   

  

 at the CxO level.
   

  

 At Databricks, our core values are at the heart of everything we do;
   

  

 creating a culture of proactiveness and a customer-centric mindset
   

  

 guides us to create a unified platform that makes data science and
   

  

 analytics accessible to everyone. We aim to inspire our customers to
   

  

 make informed decisions that push their business forward. We provide a
   

  

 user-friendly and intuitive platform that makes it easy to turn
   

  

 insights into action and fosters a culture of creativity,
   

  

 experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will be an essential
   

  

 part of this mission, using your technical expertise to demonstrate
   

  

 how our Lakehouse Platform can help customers solve their complex data
   

  

 challenges. You'll work with a collaborative, customer-focused team
   

  

 that values innovation and creativity, using your skills to create
   

  

 customised solutions to help our customers achieve their goals and
   

  

 guide their businesses forward. Join us in our quest to change how
   

  

 people work with data and make a better world!
   

  

 Reporting to the Manager, Field Engineering.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
 You will influence stakeholders at all levels through complex
   

  

 engagements with the wider cloud ecosystem and 3rd party applications,
   

  

 ensuring they are excited by the Databricks vision and solution
   

  

 strategy.
   

  

 Paired with the Strategic or Global Account executive, leveraging our
   

  

 large, multi-functional team, lead internal teams to provide analyses
   

  

 and architect solutions for the customer. Hold accountability as a
   

  

 strategic link between Databricks and the customer for identifying a
   

  

 pathway for strategic efforts and resources necessary for building a
   

  

 technology strategy.
   

  

 Technology Sales Leadership – Lead technology thought leadership and
   

  

 technology sales activities to drive the customer’s digital
   

  

 transformation vision and roadmap with Databricks. Orchestrate the
   

  

 extended team, leading customer joint envisioning sessions, to bring
   

  

 the best of Databricks technology to help the customer achieve their
   

  

 digital goals.
   

  

 Cultivate relationships - and solutions - with the partner ecosystem,
   

  

 including SIs, ISVs, and Data Collaboration partners.
   

  

 Collaborate with marketing to develop FSI content, collateral, and
   

  

 demand-generation plans.
   

  

 Digital Transformation Strategy – Own the relationship with C-level
   

  

 technology/innovation executives at the customer and build
   

  

 relationships with business leaders to achieve their business and
   

  

 technology outcomes. Understand the customer’s business goals,
   

  

 solution areas, and partner solutions to build a technology roadmap,
   

  

 enabling the customer’s innovation agenda through the utilisation of
   

  

 our technologies.
   

  

**What We Look For**
 Minimum 10 years experience working as an executive in the FSI
   

  

 vertical (directly in industry and / or deep experience working as a
   

  

 vendor to the industry)
   

  

 Intimate knowledge of the technology landscape in the FSI industry
   

  

 Comfortable across the entire value chain of FSI, including for:
   

  

**Banking**
 Customer Acquisition, Account Opening and Maintenance, Loan
   

  

 origination and Servicing, Deposit and Withdrawal Processing, Payment
   

  

 Processing, Customer Service and Support, Risk Management and
   

  

 Compliance, and/or
   

  

**Insurance**
 Risk Management and Underwriting, Claims Management, Policy Lifecycle
   

  

 Management, Finance Operations, Customer Service, Compliance and
   

  

 Regulatory Management, and Digital Transformation.
   

  

 Experience driving change at a large FSI company, with a strong
   

  

 understanding of how large FSI firms make decisions, and an ability to
   

  

 influence that decision-making process.
   

  

 Prior experience in acting as the Technology Leader for the customer
   

  

 and "go-to" person in established, long-term relationships with
   

  

 technical and/or business decision-makers at the Chief X Officer (CxO)
   

  

 level at the customer.
   

  

 Ability to innovate technical solutions to achieve customers’ business
   

  

 transformation and achieve account growth targets, by leveraging
   

  

 technology and industry knowledge to deliver digital solutions to
   

  

 accelerate the customer's digital vision.
   

  

 Proactively builds and maintains a strong knowledge of the Banking and
   

  

 Insurance (FSI) industry, associated business strategy, and key
   

  

 industry partners and solutions. Coordinate with internal/external
   

  

 industry experts to gather industry knowledge to improve outcomes for
   

  

 the customer.
   

  

 Strong knowledge of key regulations in the Banking and Insurance
   

  

 industry, with a particular focus on European regulations.
   

  

**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

**Compliance**
**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Senior Consultant
description:
*Vill du vara med och driva arbetet inom molntjänster och IT-infrastruktur?
   

  

 På Advania hjälper vi våra kunder att modernisera sina IT-miljöer, optimera leveransen och skapa säkra, skalbara IT-lösningar. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i ett team av experter och vidareutveckla din kompetens i samarbete med andra specialister.*
 Senior Consultant på Advania 🚀
   

  

 Som Senior Consultant hos oss spelar du en central roll i att initiera, implementera och förvalta moderna IT-lösningar som möter kundernas verksamhetsbehov.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**
* Teknisk rådgivning för ett antal kunder med fokus på säkerhet och proaktivitet.
* Design och implementering av tekniska lösningar on-prem och i cloud.
* Drift och utveckling av centrala servermiljöer och managerade tjänster.


**Du ansvarar även för att:**
* Äga och driva mindre förbättringsprojekt för nya och befintliga tjänster mot kund.
* Förbereda, leda och handleda workshops med kund som teknisk rådgivare.


 Rollen är baserad i Solna och du rapporterar till Head of Delivery Teams. Teamet som du ingår i består av ett mindre team på 4-6 personer och är en del av en större grupp med bred specialistkompetens inom exempelvis Nätverk, Windows Server, Klient, Microsoft SQL och Microsoft 365. Du samarbetar nära andra konsulter samt med våra sälj- och projektteam.
   

  

 Vad som gör denna roll unik⭐
   

  

 Det här är en roll för dig som vill arbeta i en teknisk miljö där din expertis inom Microsofts plattformar verkligen kommer till sin rätt. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med avancerade molnprojekt, samarbeta med andra specialister och kontinuerligt fördjupa din specialistkunskap. Här finns stora möjligheter att påverka och driva innovation tillsammans med våra kunder och likasinnade kollegor.
   

  

 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 För att du ska trivas och lyckas hos oss söker vi dig med en bakgrund inom konsultrollen och tydligt affärsfokus. Du arbetar idag som Technical Account Manager eller tekniskt ansvarig och trivs i en roll där teknik och kundfokus möts.
   

  

 Du är ansvarstagande, har ett starkt driv och en entreprenöriell ådra. Du motiveras av att hjälpa kunder att förverkliga sina verksamhetsbehov och att driva tekniken framåt.
   

  

 Hos oss får du arbeta i team där laget går före jaget. Din vardag kommer i stor utsträckning att handla om att lösa problem tillsammans, i en miljö där du använder din specialistkunskap för att skapa verkligt kundvärde.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Som har erfarenhet av Microsofts infrastruktur, med fokus på servermiljöer och Azure.
* Certifiering inom AZ-104 Azure Administrator Associate eller AZ-800 Administering Windows Server Hybrid Core Infrastructure är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av MSP-branschen är meriterande.


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
   

  

 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.

title: Tech Management Consultant
description:
Are you passionate about bridging business and technology? Do you want to work on impactful tech transformation projects at some of Sweden’s most well-known companies? Influence Tech is expanding, and we’re looking for a Tech Management Consultant with experience in driving technology transformation projects, ERP and other core business system implementations, and cloud optimization to join our growing team.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to work on fantastic projects – in areas like IT ERP and HR core system implementation, technology strategy, automation and AI agents, cloud optimization, and IT governance.
* A flat, collaborative company structure focused on work/life balance rather than internal processes.
* Projects that allow you to combine technology capabilities with a human-centric approach.
* A culture that embraces innovation, collective intelligence, and doing things differently.
* An active role in building the future of our company – shaping offerings, practice areas, and recruitment efforts.


**Your Role**
* Lead and deliver projects and programs within IT and digital transformation, especially in the areas of core business systems (e.g. ERP), IT strategy, or automation & AI agents.
* Work in the space between business and IT, helping clients define needs and turn them into actionable tech initiatives.
* Act as a trusted advisor in technology assessments, system implementations, and strategic IT planning.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and help clients align tech solutions with business goals.
* Mentor junior consultants and contribute to business development and sales.


**Who We’re Looking For**
* 6-12 years of experience within technology and management consulting, including hands-on leadership of complex, business-critical IT projects.
* Solid experience in delivering and leading projects in one or more of the following areas:
+ ERP implementation and core system modernization
+ Business analysis and technology/business alignment
+ IT strategy and governance
+ Automation technologies, incuding AI agents
+ Cloud optimization

* Proven ability to take on roles such as Program/Project Manager, Technology Lead, or IT Strategy Consultant.
* A strong understanding of business processes and how to align them with the right tech solutions.
* Confident in building client relationships and contributing to sales opportunities.
* University degree (minimum Master’s or similar)
* Fluent in both Swedish and English.


**About Influence Tech**
 Influence Tech is a growing Tech Management Consulting firm based in Stockholm and part of the
 **Newground Alliance** 
 – a network of 12 niche consulting firms and over 300 consultants. Together, we share the motto
 **“Consulting Done Right”** 
 – delivering lasting value for our clients while ensuring a healthy and balanced workplace for our team. We collaborate closely with our colleagues across Newground Alliance in client engagements, strategic business development, and sales initiatives.
   

  

 We’re building something different – a warm, value-driven, and ambitious company.
   

  

 As a small firm of around 25-30 people, we work closely together in a flat organization where communication is open and decisions are made quickly. You’ll join a supportive team that values work-life balance and personal growth. If you’re passionate about making a difference and helping organizations get more value from technology – we want to meet you.
   

  

**We review applications continuously – apply today!**
 https://influencetech.se
   

  

 We are Tech Management Consultants. Creating value by tech expertise and collective intelligence. Combining technology and data capabilities with a human centric approach.

title: Senior Solution Architect
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes more than 150 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced Senior Solution Architect to lead and own the technical strategy for our US market. This pivotal role requires a visionary leader who can drive innovation, guide development teams, and ensure alignment with our global technical objectives.
   

  

 You will collaborate with colleagues in the US Product & Technology teams as well as with those working in other markets to identify potential cross-market synergies and opportunities.
   

  

 You will manage the architecture vision, and the enabling capabilities required to meet them. You will report to our Lead Architect and work in close collaboration with our US product engineering teams and other architects.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are a leader with a proven track record in developing and driving technology initiatives – always looking to push boundaries and make a significant impact. Complex challenges don't deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.
   

  

 You work well with others and know how to convey complex concepts to a wide range of stakeholders. Your communication style is clear and inclusive. The ability to deal with complexity and heterogeneous environments, including both legacy and modern technologies, is key.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and implement the technical strategy for the US region, ensuring alignment with the company's overall vision and goals.
* Serve as the technical leader and mentor for development teams, fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.
* Oversee the architecture design and development of complex web-based systems and applications.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and delivery of solutions.
* Conduct regular reviews and assessments of technical processes and systems to identify areas for improvement.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies to drive continuous innovation.
* Provide technical guidance and support during project planning, execution, and delivery phases.
* Ensure adherence to best practices in software development, architecture, and agile methodologies.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a Senior Solution Architect or similar role, with a focus on technical strategy and leadership.
* Strong expertise in software architecture, development, and lifecycle management.
* Excellent leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to inspire and guide development teams.
* Proficiency in relevant technologies and tools, such as Azure, C#, .NET Core, and microservices architecture.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and regions.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software
   

  

 #msl

title: Lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala samhälle? Just nu söker vi på Atea dig som vill jobba som lösningsarkitekt med fokus på att bygga kundlösningar med ServiceNow som plattform. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som präglas av medarbetare som brinner för att bygga Sverige med it, medarbetare som tar personligt ansvar och sätter laget före jaget. Vi har kunderna och du kompetensen – låt oss bygga vidare på vårt vinnande koncept tillsammans!
   

  

**Din roll**
 Teamet består av amibitiösa och erfarna ServiceNow-konsulter, säljare och leveransansvariga. Våra uppdrag består av projekt, konsultuppdrag, förvaltning samt olika typer av kundaktiviteter. Vi ingår i affärsområdet Information Management och i din roll som konsult på Atea får du genom laganda, personligt ansvar och ett brinnande engagemang möjlighet utveckla, etablera och leverera Ateas erbjudande för ServiceNow. Vi jobbar dagligen med våra kollegor inom ServiceNow runt om i landet där vi drar nytta av varandras kunskaper.
   

  

 Som Lösningsarkitekt på Atea arbetar du nära våra kunder tillsammans med dina kollegor i ett agilt och engagerat team. Du hjälper våra kunder på deras digitala resa genom att säkerställa värdet av kundens investering samt ansvara för design och implementation av projekt och förvaltningsaktiviteter.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter i rollen som Lösningsarkitekt är:**
* Implementation av plattformen och olika integrationslösningar
* Ansvarar för kvalitet, kapacitet, tillgänglighet samt access och säkerhet för lösningen och dess eventuella integrationer
* Huvudansvarig för den processmässiga samt tekniska lösningsdesignen med fokus på hållbar utveckling av plattformen
* Rådgivning och problemlösning
* Utveckling av Ateas erbjudande inom området


**Vem är du?**
 Vi ser att du gillar att arbeta i team och vill vara med att bygga laget. Du är självgående och har sinne för att hitta nya lösningar. Du uppskattar möjligheten att möta alla typer av kunder och arbeta i en varierande vardag. Du sätter höga mål för dig själv och söker aktivt utmaningar samt utvecklingsmöjligheter. Att aktivt och kontinuerligt dela med dig av din kunskap till både kollegor och kund är en självklarhet för dig.
   

  

 För tjänsten som Lösningsarkitekt inom ServiceNow ser vi att du har med dig följande kunskaper:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av kravanalys, design, utveckling och implementation av ServiceNow- plattformen
* Omfattande förståelse och kunskap om nyckelteknologi som är relevant för ServiceNow-integrationslösningar och förmågor
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla integrationer, appar och mer komplexa lösningar
* God förståelse för ”on-prem” installationer av ServiceNow
* Flytande i det svenska språket i tal och skrift samt goda kunskaper i engelska


**Om Atea**
 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av it-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
   

  

 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
   

  

**Kontakt & mer information**
 Med anledning av sommaren och semesterperioden kommer återkoppling på din ansökan eller svar på dina frågor dröja längre än vanligt. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Marcus Aleson, Konsultchef, via marcus.aleson@atea.se.
   

  

 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
   

  

 Atea vill vara The Place To Be och därför värdesätter vi de kvalitéer som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
*Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.*
**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Cloud-Arkitekt
description:
Är du en erfaren specialist med hög kompetens och lång erfarenhet inom Cloud-arkitektur som söker nästa utmaning? Då är du varmt välkommen att hänga med på Avegas framgångsresa och fortsätta att bygga upp vårt Cloud-erbjudande!
 



  





 Avega är ett konsultföretag inom digital transformation och innovation. Hos oss hittar du erfarna specialistkonsulter som tar ledande/rådgivande nyckelroller hos kunderna. Vi erbjuder dig:
 


* En dynamisk arbetsplats med härliga kollegor.
* Ett konsultuppdrag som du är med och väljer, utifrån ditt intresseområde och erfarenhet. Enligt vår matchningsprincip 1:1 siktar vi på en 100% matchning mellan kund och konsult för att försäkra oss om att du får arbeta i spännande uppdrag.
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, inte bara i ditt uppdrag men även genom Avegas kompetensforum Elevate.
* Roliga bolagsaktiveter och fantastiska nätverksmöjligheter.



  





 Rollen syftar till att utifrån våra kunders behov, designa och utveckla framtidssäkra lösningar på teknik i framkant att möta morgondagens utmaningar. För att lyckas, ställs höga krav på såväl personliga egenskaper, teknisk kompetens som samarbetsförmåga.
 



 Är du den vi söker har du en bred teknisk kompetens för att förstå kundens befintliga IT-landskap och IT-system, både vilka möjligheter de erbjuder och vilka begränsningar de har. Du ska ha en god förståelse för arkitekturprinciper samt erfarenhet av analys och design, planering och implementering av Cloud-lösningar.
 



  





**Övriga kvalifikationer:** 



* Minst sex års erfarenhet av rollen som IT-arkitekt.
* Erfarenhet inom någon av Cloud teknologierna Azure, AWS eller GCP.
* Vana att fånga och dokumentera kundens behov, driva workshops, rekommendera och implementera kundlösningar samt hantera kundförväntningar.
* Utbildningsbakgrund inom IT.
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD, Docker och Kubernetes.
* Vi ser positivt på om du har relevanta Cloud-certifieringar.



  





 Vi tror också att du gillar att se kreativa lösningar och bidra med egna förslag på olika funktioner i våra projekt. Samarbete är förmodligen ett ledord hos dig och att arbeta nära sina kollegor för att nå resultat faller sig naturligt.
 



  





 Låter det spännande? Hör av dig så kan vi prata vidare!

title: Visa Direct EU -  Manager Solutioning
description:
As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
   

  





 At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
   

  





**You're** 
 an Individual.
 **We're** 
 the team for you.
 **Together** 
 , let's transform the way the world pays.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.
   

  





 Visa Direct is a payment service that Visa provides to clients (issuers, acquirers, processors, merchants and payment service providers) to facilitate fund transfers/disbursements to people around the world for Card, Account and Digital Wallets products. This role covers both sides of Visa Direct product – Card and Account/ Wallets.
   

  





 The Solution Manager will play a critical role in the development of this rapidly growing business. Working as part of a growing team with a start-up culture, and supported by strong strategy, global product and technical teams, he/she will be responsible for providing consultancy services to originators and to identify, define, and initiate execution of real-time payment technical solutions - keeping in mind evolving market, client and consumer needs and with the objective of driving significant future market growth for Visa.
   

  





 The role has direct responsibility for enablement of regional and local Europe region Acquirers. The role holder must possess a unique combination of technical skill, deep understanding of payments, mobile technology, processing, banking systems, consumer behavior, SLDC and Visa’s business. Key Responsibilities/accountabilities
   

  





**Key responsibilities/accountabilities**



* Engage European Acquirers, Financial Institutions, PSPs, Processors, Merchants, and deliver agreed targets for Visa Direct enabler and originator enablement and growth
* Lead consultancy on best practices covering all aspects of Visa Direct origination for card, account and wallets solutions
* Work with clients and partners to drive enablement and setup optimisation that will facilitate revenue growth
* Drive definition of technical solutions that meet partner and Visa growth objectives
* Contribute to the optimisation of the current delivery framework and processes to accelerate time to revenue – identifying trends and proposing solutions for common client pain points
* Contribute to the product and process enhancements, identifying areas of improvements and implementing solutions
* Project manage and communicate the enablement and optimisation of new and existing clients
* Report against OKRs of their portfolio of clients


**Qualifications**

**Qualifications:**



* Mid-level experience in a Programme/Product role for new payment product technologies and capabilities – including technical/commercial/advisory
* Ability to balance complex mix of interpersonal skills, technical proficiency, and commercial judgement to drive outcomes
* Significant experience simplifying the complex and removing commercial and technical barriers to execution
* Experience in engaging with 3rd party vendors
* Good understanding of the payments compliance landscape
* Significant experience working across European markets in the payments sector
* Excellent communication and influencing skills, both written and verbal
* Passion for future of payments
* Excellent analytical skills and exposure in the latest BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI etc.)
* Solid understanding of modern technologies (e.g. APIs, cloud solutions etc.)
* Excellent Programme/Project Management skills. Exposure in both Waterfall and Agile frameworks is a must
* Good understanding of the full Software Development Lifecycle
* Unbounded intellectual curiosity and bias for action
* Driven, resilient, with attention to detail, great with numbers and positive under pressure
* Good understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle


**Additional Information**

 Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Solution Sales Specialist - SASE
description:
**Solution Sales Specialist – SASE Expert**
*Do you know Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) inside and out? Can you turn complex network security concepts into compelling stories that win over customers?*
 We are looking for a
 **Solution Sales Specialist** 
 who can bring our appealing
 **end-to-end connectivity solution** 
 and future
 **SASE offering to life** 
 for potential customers. You won’t be the one closing the deal—but you’ll be the person the sales team
 **relies on to win over the room** 
 . When enterprise customers are weighing their options, you’ll be the expert they trust.
   

  

 As part of a newly established Pan-Nordic team, you will work across the Nordics and Germany, helping businesses secure their digital infrastructure. With a growing portfolio of
 **multi-vendor SASE solutions** 
 (including Versa, Aruba, Cisco, and Fortinet), you’ll play a
 **critical role in positioning GlobalConnect as a trusted** 
**agnostic** 
**Managed Service Provider** 
 .
   

  

 Your day will be a mix of on one hand to
 **pro-actively work with sales** 
 , frequently
 **joining customer meetings** 
 and on the other hand
 **compose standardized solutions** 
 in collaboration with pre-sales and Product management.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Be the go-to SASE expert in sales meetings—turning technical solutions into engaging, real-world business value.
* Challenging the sales teams to find and articulate SASE opportunities in their customer portfolios or as new logos.
* Guide customers through their network security journey, ensuring they understand the benefits of GlobalConnect’s SASE offering.
* Collaborate with sales teams, providing technical expertise that strengthens their ability to sell secured solutions.
* Develop and refine our SASE sales strategy, working closely with vendors and internal teams.
* Craft compelling proposals and high-level design in corporation with solutions architects to ensure customer needs are met with the right solution.


**Why join us?**
 You’ll be part of an
 **ambitious and growing team** 
 , working across borders in a dynamic, high-growth company. At GlobalConnect, we challenge the status quo, pushing the boundaries of what’s possible as a Managed Service Provider. Backed by EQT, we have the scale and ambition to make a real impact in the industry.
   

  

 GlobalConnect brings an unique end-to-end connectivity offering to the market where both underlay connectivity and the network as a service is bundled as an integrated managed service, with one SLA. This is your opportunity to
 **shape our SASE strategy, influence product development, and be the trusted expert that sales teams bring into high-stakes meetings.** 
 You’ll work with cutting-edge technology from
 **major industry vendors** 
 , translating it into real business impact for our customers.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, You Need**
* Deep expertise in SASE and network—whether from solution consulting, a pre-sales or sales role.
* A natural ability to explain complex technical solutions in a way that engages and persuades business leaders to understand the integrated value of our services.
* Flair and experience with enterprise sales processes and comfort to spare and challenge your colleagues in Sales.
* Experience from working in a Managed Service Provider environment, a system integrator or vendor (e.g., Versa, Aruba, Cisco, Fortinet). Regardless background, you believe that the market can be won as a managed service provider.
* A structured and strategic approach to prioritize and drive SASE initiatives to impact adoption and reach budgets.


 💡
 **Interested? We’d love to hear from you!**
**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: GRIP Reporter – Scandinavia and EU
description:
**Who we are:**
 For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world’s most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.
   

  

 Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It’s a place where you can genuinely make an impact – and be recognized for it.
   

  

 We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.
   

  

**About GRIP:**
 Global Relay is an innovative business and this extends to its approach in developing highly engaging and informative content services for its prospects, customers, partners and employees. GRIP, which is an acronym for Global Relay Intelligence & Practice, was launched in early 2023, is a product in its own right and will be a new revenue line in the near future. GRIP functions with a high degree of editorial autonomy, has its own team and identity, and, being fully supported by Global Relay and its founder, is not held back by the usual foundational obstructions that start-ups have to put in place such as resource, infrastructure, capital and premises. GRIP delivers a modern and practical streamed content service that focuses on informing the C-suite on essential developments, news, and intelligence to enable them to conduct their roles with speed, confidence and precision. The GRIP founding team has considerable experience in this area and has a strong track-record in meeting its business objectives.
   

  

**Your role:**
 With direction from senior GRIP staff you will research, source and create content for publication and/or broadcasting for our specialist information service. You will craft and deliver content that appeals to, informs and stimulates a professional audience. You will be responsible for the expansion of our content coverage of Scandinavia, the Baltics and the EU more generally.
   

  

 You will support the Director, Content and Community in all relevant project work while collaborating directly with a friendly and experienced team based in London and NYC. Because you will be GRIP’s sole team member and our ambassador in Stockholm high levels of motivation and the ability to work independently are both critical. This on-site role reports to the Director, Content and Community in London and is based in Stockholm. Although you will be required in the office full time, significant flexibility to meet with sources, identify leads and contributors and attend events outside of the office will be offered.
   

  

**Your job:**
* Carry out independent research and write timely, informative and insightful articles on key subject areas covered by GRIP (compliance, regulation and technology) with a specific focus on ongoing developments in Scandinavia and the EU
* Develop leads and contacts and maintain close relationships with our professional community in Sweden, Scandinavia and the EU
* Assist with the creation of podcasts for GRIP on a variety of topics pertinent to a global compliance audience
* Assist with all ongoing projects including research reports, our proprietary rules navigator and other assets and functionality being developed
* Ensure that content published out of the Stockholm office meets the high standards expected by a sophisticated and demanding global professional audience
* Work closely with the local sales and marketing team as required
* Help Stockholm office colleagues in preparing for and conducting events for clients and prospects within the corporate and regulatory arenas
* Represent GRIP and GR as required at internal and external corporate events as well as conferences
* Adhere to GR policy and legal and contractual guidelines


**About you:**
* Interest in compliance, regulatory affairs, technology and the legal ecosystem
* Ability to listen to and build rapport with contacts, leads and sources
* Demonstrable ability to produce interesting content for a specialist audience
* A track record of independently generating content that differentiates a publication
* Experience of working autonomously
* Demonstrable research and writing experience and skills set
* Affinity for technology, systems and processes
* Outstanding attention to detail
* Logical thinker with excellent organisational skills
* Natural curiosity and desire to keep learning
* Principled, ethical approach to reporting and pride in one’s work
* High levels of motivation and energy
* Tenacity, determination, integrity and resilience


**Qualifications:**
* 3-5 years of professional work experience as a reporter, technical writer or researcher
* Bachelor’s Degree in relevant discipline


**What you can expect:**
 At Global Relay, there’s no ceiling to what you can achieve. It’s the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You’ll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you’ll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.
   

  

 Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
   

  

 We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.
   

  

 We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.
   

  

 To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

title: Solution Architect - Finance IT
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 At Scania, we’re on an ambitious journey to drive the shift toward a sustainable transport system — and we know that a strong, modern Finance IT landscape is key to that success. As part of the TRATON Group, we are shaping the future of mobility through smart digital solutions, collaboration, and innovation.
   

  

 Our Finance IT team works at the heart of this transformation, partnering with stakeholders across the business to deliver reliable, flexible, and future-ready solutions that support Scania’s financial operations today — and tomorrow.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We’re looking for an experienced Solution Architect to join our Finance IT team and play a vital role in evolving and modernizing our Finance IT landscape. In this role, you’ll partner with business stakeholders, architects, and development teams to identify, design, and implement solutions that deliver clear business value while aligning with Scania’s long-term IT strategy.
   

  

 You’ll be at the forefront of selecting and shaping solutions that improve business processes, enhance scalability, and build a solid foundation for our future digital ecosystem — all while keeping sustainability and efficiency in focus.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their needs, define requirements, and translate them into robust, scalable solutions.
* Evaluate and recommend market-leading solutions and new technologies that support the evolving needs of the Finance domain.
* Design and apply architectural frameworks that align with Scania’s enterprise architecture principles and long-term strategy.
* Ensure consistency and integration across various IT systems, bridging legacy systems with new cloud-based solutions.
* Work closely with related domains, platform architects, and other IT teams to secure end-to-end coherence and efficiency.
* Drive continuous improvement to ensure that the Finance IT landscape remains modern, reliable, and ready to support future business models.


**Who You Are**
 You’re a strategic, forward-thinking professional with a passion for turning complex challenges into smart, sustainable solutions. You thrive at the intersection of technology and business, and you know how to build strong relationships across teams and domains.
   

  

 We believe you bring:
   

  

  

* Proven experience as a Solution Architect with a focus on cloud technologies (e.g., AWS) and modern IT landscapes.
* Strong ability to work strategically with business stakeholders to define and deliver IT solutions that create real value.
* A track record of evaluating, selecting, and implementing IT solutions and emerging technologies that align with business goals.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills to guide discussions, align stakeholders, and promote architectural best practices.
* Experience working with both standardized IT systems and custom solutions — and the ability to integrate them into a cohesive architecture.
* Bonus if you have knowledge of SAP S/4HANA, other leading ERP systems, or previous experience working within the Finance domain.


 At Scania, you’ll be part of a supportive, forward-leaning team where your ideas and expertise can shape the future. If you’re ready to make an impact — we’d love to meet you!
   

  

 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-17. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: johan.skoldh@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing
   

  

**Product Marketing Manager**
**Location:** 
 EMEA - Remote
   

  

 At Canonical, the product marketing team is not just marketing products—we're building the best Go-To-Market (GTM) engine in the open source world. Our mission is to take the power of open source innovation and bring it to businesses everywhere, from the data center to the edge. We're growing fast and looking for a Product Marketing Manager (PMM) to join our team—someone who loves technology, thrives in fast-paced environments, and wants to make a global impact.
   

  

 This is a hands-on, multi-disciplinary, and dynamic position, requiring close collaboration with the Product, engineering, content, Sales, and other Marketing teams. The ideal candidate is passionate about technology, technology marketing, and the use of technology in marketing. They prefer to work in an environment that emphasises ownership of GTM campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity, and a drive to always improve oneself / the team / the organisation. They love solving problems, getting hands-on, experimenting, measuring, and using automation to make daily life easier.
   

  

**Why You'll Love This Role**
 You'll own the GTM strategy for key products, shaping messaging and positioning that speaks to developers and enterprise buyers alike.
   

  

 You'll collaborate cross-functionally with product management, sales, regional marketing, content, and partner marketing teams to bring campaigns to life.
   

  

 You'll get creative, crafting compelling advertising, launch plans, and campaigns that make our products stand out in a competitive landscape.
   

  

 You'll measure impact, using data to refine messaging, optimize marketing funnels, and drive customer engagement.
   

  

 You'll be part of a truly global team, working with colleagues in over 85 countries in a fully remote, high-performance environment.
   

  

**As a product marketing manager, you will:**
* Develop and execute go-to-market (GTM) strategies for a range of products.
* Lead messaging and positioning efforts ensuring our products stand out in a competitive market.
* Lead content planning with product managers —from website copy to whitepapers, blogs, and sales enablement materials.
* Collaborate on marketing campaigns, partnering with regional marketing teams to execute integrated campaigns that drive pipeline growth.
* Launch new products and features, leading cross-functional teams to drive awareness and adoption.
* Run competitive analysis, staying ahead of market trends and evolving our positioning accordingly.
* Support the customer success team on driving customer engagement and growth, working on strategies to upsell and cross-sell across our customer base.
* Plan and execute global events, live webinars, and community meetups that align with our GTM priorities.


**What we are looking for in you**
* A passion for technology and open source—you get excited about innovation, software, and community-driven development.
* Strong storytelling skills—you know how to craft messaging that resonates with both technical and business audiences.
* Growth mindset—someone who thrives on experimentation, learning, and continuous improvement.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.


**Nice-to-have skills**
* Data-driven mindset, using insights to refine strategies and improve performance.
* Experience in product marketing for enterprise software, cloud, DevOps, or open-source solutions.
* Experience with demand generation, understanding how to translate GTM strategies into pipeline growth.
* Comfort working cross-functionally with product, sales, partners, and marketing teams.


**What we offer you**
 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: IT Security Architect (m/f/d) - Business Applications
description:
Octapharma specializes in the development of highly pure pharmaceuticals made of human blood plasma. As part of a family-owned enterprise, Octapharma in Vienna is not only the largest production site, but also a successful research location of the Octapharma Group.
 **This position is available in either Vienna (Austria), Stockholm (Sweden) or Lachen (Switzerland). Candidates may indicate their preferred location.** 
 Since our company continues to grow, we are now hiring for our team.
   

  

**Your New Challenges Which Will Inspire You**
* Continuously assess and manage the security and risk posture across our enterprise application portfolio
* Guide IT business partner teams in designing and delivering secure business application solutions
* Define and standardize authorization concepts in support of our IAM initiatives, ensuring consistency across platforms such as SAP, Veeva, and Kinaxis
* Lead the development of integration security standards for APIs, data exchanges, and authentication mechanisms
* Classify business applications and align security controls based on criticality, organizational value streams, and process sensitivity
* Collaborate closely with security, enterprise architecture, infrastructure, and application teams to implement comprehensive cloud and SaaS security models


**Your Profile That Will Convince Us**
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Security, or related discipline
* 5+ years of experience in IT Security for enterprise application like SAP, including 2+ years in security architecture
* Knowledge of enterprise/security architecture frameworks (e.g. TOGAF, SABSA) and business capability modeling
* Hands-on with IAM systems and the development of authorization models and role concepts
* Solid understanding of cloud security architectures (AWS, Azure, private/hybrid cloud)
* Strong collaboration, communication and documentation skills in English (German is a plus)
* Proactive, structured and responsible approach to work


**Our Attractive Benefits For You**
* Wide range of tasks in an international setting, flexibility and personal responsibility
* Reliable employer with generous employee benefits and a salary customary in the market.
* Familiar setting of a family-owned enterprise with benefits such as Do & Co staff restaurant, extraordinary staff events and many more:


**Additional Information**
 The minimum gross wage according to the collective agreement (chemical industry) for your new job is EUR 4.270,14. We strive to adapt your salary to your range of tasks and to your profile, which is why we are ready to pay wages higher than collectively agreed. This is a legal requirement in Austria which is not applicable for Switzerland/Sweden.
   

  

 We are looking forward to new, committed employees who join forces with us to promote our strong growth in order to keep enabling our patients to live a better life - because it is in our blood! Is it in your blood too? We are looking forward to receiving your application via our online career portal.
   

  

**Your Contact**
 Johanna Proksch
   

  

 Octapharma Pharmazeutika Produktionsges.m.b.H.
   

  

 Oberlaaer Straße 235, 1100 Wien
   

  

 T: +43 (1) 610 32 - 4299

title: (Senior) IT Consultant - Principal Investors and Private Equity | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 More so than ever, technology is driving business growth and must therefore be a top consideration in M&A decision making. Assessing technological capabilities in the due diligence phase requires knowledge across IT architecture, enterprise systems and cybersecurity – we are looking for passionate talent! As a (Senior) IT Consultant for our PIPE (Principal Investors & Private Equity) practice area, you will be focused on helping the world’s largest private equity firms address their strategic technology challenges, whether they are buying or selling a business. We look for new colleagues in our offices in Stockholm, Helsinki, Oslo, and Copenhagen!
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
 ▪ bring multiple years of experience in IT strategy and consulting, professional software development or IT project management in a tech related corporate development or start-up
   

  

 ▪ gathered basic understanding of technology financials and how it impacts deal value
   

  

 ▪ are familiar with working within a Merger and Acquisition (M&A) environment, with a focus upon technology due diligence, technology carve-out, technology PMI or PE-related value creation initiative with a portfolio company
   

  

 ▪ are a strategic thinker who likes to work creatively and analytically in an environment focused on exceptional problem-solving
   

  

 ▪ bring stellar analytical and conceptual skills, strong customer focus and mental agility with a result-orientation
   

  

 ▪ obtained a university degree with above average academic performance in a STEM related field or business management
   

  

 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
 ▪ You will drive groundbreaking projects by using agile methods and modern approaches within the scope of strategic IT implementation for clients and by actively steering the relevant modules
   

  

 ▪ You will smooth the path for tailored, future-oriented customer journeys based on precise analysis of the situation and with current market developments and trends, such as machine learning, in mind
   

  

 ▪ You will design and optimize unique IT architectures within the framework of enterprise solution requirements, modern custom software developments, and sustainable digital solutions, including cyber resilience
   

  

 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of top talents, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we cultivate a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Network Architect
description:
**Job Description**
 The world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing the organization’s network infrastructure, ensuring it is robust, scalable, and aligned with business goals.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key part in:*
* Leading the design and implementation of Network infrastructures, including LAN, WAN, VPNs, cloud networks, and SD-WAN.
* Collaborating with IT and business stakeholders to understand requirements and develop a long-term strategic roadmap for Network architecture.
* Ensuring network solutions are Scalable, high-performing, secure, and aligned with business objectives.
* Designing and implementing Network security solutions to safeguard the network infrastructure while ensuring compliance with Security policies and Regulatory requirements.
* Continuously monitoring and evaluating Network performance, Identifying, and Implementing optimization techniques to enhance speed, reliability, and scalability.
* Researching, evaluating, and recommending New Networking technologies, hardware, and software solutions.
* Leading the troubleshooting of complex Network issues and providing guidance to network engineers on resolving day-to-day network problems.
* Identifying opportunities to implement Network automation tools to streamline operations and improve efficiency.


**Your profile**
* Proven experience in designing and implementing enterprise-level network infrastructures.
* Strong expertise in Networking technologies, including LAN, WAN, VPNs, SD-WAN, cloud networking, and network security.
* Hands-on experience with Network hardware such as Routers, Switches, Firewalls, and load balancers.
* Familiarity with Cloud platforms and hybrid network architectures.
* Experience with network automation tools and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Ansible) is a plus.
* Relevant certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, AWS Certified Advanced Networking, or similar are highly desirable.


*Note: You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Career growth opportunities with access to training and certifications in the latest Networking technologies.


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Marketing Coordinator
company_industry: Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing and Airlines and Aviation
description:
*Vill du kombinera operativt och strategiskt marknadsarbete i en internationell teknisk miljö där du blir en viktig kugge i att utveckla företagets globala profil. Hos ST Airborne Systems får du arbeta i ett innovativt företag där teknisk utveckling möter samhällsnytta i en kultur som förenar det familjära med det globala.* 




  





**Om företaget** 




 ST Airborne Systems är en global aktör inom luftburna övervakningssystem för marina ändamål. Systemen används i uppdrag som bidrar till att övervaka landsgränser, skydda naturresurser, stödja sök- och räddningsinsatser, bekämpa smuggling och piratverksamhet samt övervaka miljön, exempelvis genom att upptäcka oljeutsläpp.
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Som Marketing Coordinator arbetar du nära försäljnings- och marknadsavdelningen och ansvarar för att samordna och driva företagets marknadsföring och kommunikation. Rollen omfattar både operativa och koordinerande uppgifter inom business-to-business-marknadsföring i en tekniskt orienterad miljö. Dina ansvarsområden inkluderar:
 



  




* Planera, koordinera och delta i internationella mässor, seminarier och kundevent.
* Ansvara för att utveckla och uppdatera webbplats och sociala medier för att stärka företagets externa profil.
* Arbeta med och utveckla produktion av marknadsmaterial och kundanpassade presentationer.
* Arbeta med och utveckla ”content”, både grafiskt och skriftligt.
* Fungera som offertstöd och arbeta med utveckling av offertflöden, exempelvis genom att undersöka effektivisering med hjälp av AI.
* Koordinera samarbetet med externa partners och leverantörer samt samverka internt mellan olika funktioner.



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 



* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom marknadsföring, kommunikation eller liknande, alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av marknadsarbete, gärna i en internationell B2B-miljö.
* Erfarenhet av content produktion och sociala medier.
* Erfarenhet av mässor, event och kampanjplanering.
* Vana av CRM-system och Officepaketet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska, både i tal och skrift.



  





 Vi ser det som högst meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Adobe Creative Cloud och digitala kampanj- och analysverktyg, om du tidigare har arbetat med AI-stöd i sälj- eller offertprocesser samt om du har ytterligare språkkunskaper utöver engelska. För att trivas hos ST Airborne Systems är du självgående, prestigelös och initiativrik. Du är social, lyhörd och har ett öga för kvalitet och detaljer, med en genuin vilja att hitta lösningar.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar ST Airborne Systems med Reperio Search. Skicka din ansökan via länken nedan eller kontakta Malin Nordh (072–325 66 96) eller Fredrik Hellström (073–540 03 31) för mer information. ST Airborne Systems välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och ser mångfald som en styrka. Vi ser gärna kvinnliga sökanden för att bidra till jämnare könsfördelning.

title: Systemintegratör
description:
Vill du bidra och verka i en framtidsbransch där megatrender som IoT, hållbarhet, energibesparing och digitalisering är vardag? I rollen som Systemintegratör arbetar du med att utveckla och förbättra den tekniska infrastrukturen och fastighetsdriften i några av samhällets viktigaste byggnader.
   

  

**Hos Oss Får Du**
* Arbeta med innovativ teknik i ett etablerat bolag med stort fokus på hållbarhet
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter där du själv äger din egen utveckling i bolaget
* Ett sammansvetsat team med hög teknisk kompetens med ett gemensamt mål att lyckas tillsammans


 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 I denna roll samarbetar du nära våra automationsingenjörer och projektledare inom PLC/DUC-programmering. Du kommer att arbeta med ett brett spektrum av fabrikat och kommunikationsprotokoll och ha en ledande roll i projekt där du ansvarar för tekniken och att kundens förväntningar på kvalitet och ekonomi uppnås. Eftersom arbetet är kundnära, kommer du även att spela en aktiv roll i att bygga och utveckla kundrelationer samt leda projekt mot slutkund.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Akademisk examen inom teknik eller motsvarande kompetens som vi bedömer som likvärdig
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom en liknande roll, gärna inom fastighetsautomation, industriell automation eller relaterat IT-område
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med nätverk och IP-konfigurationer
* B-körkort
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att serva och underhålla teknisk utrustning, särskilt inom fastighetsautomation och SCADA-system.
* Erfarenhet av att programmera, konfigurera och integrera SCADA- och PLC-system, inklusive datamodellering, signalmappning, felsökning och arbete med vanliga nätverksprotokoll (t.ex. BACnet, Modbus, TCP/IP).
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet inom fastighetsbranschen, industriarbete eller som drifttekniker samt kunskap inom VVS och fastighetsteknik


 Som person är du lösningsorienterad, analytisk och noggrann. Du identifierar snabbt problem och hittar effektiva lösningar samtidigt som du säkerställer hög kvalitet. Du är kommunikativ och samarbetar lätt med både kollegor och kunder. Vidare är du strukturerad, arbetar effektivt mot deadlines och kan hantera dokumentation noggrant och korrekt.
   

  

 Observera att rekryteringsprocessen kan ta lite längre tid än vanligt under sommaren på grund av semestrar. Vi återkommer så snart vi kan!
   

  

 Att vara anställd hos Nordomatic kan innebära att behöva ge samtycke till sekretessbevis och registerkontroll.

title: Senior Cyber Security Consultant | Technology Transformation | Financial Services | Stockholm
description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
